programme.title: Rear Window (1998)
programme.desc: A wheelchair-bound architect alleviates his boredom by watching his neighbours in a nearby apartment block from his window. However, when he witnesses a murder he is unable to persuade anyone to believe him and is forced to enlist his girlfriend's help to prove he did not imagine the whole thing. Remake of Hitchcock's thriller, featuring Christopher Reeve's last performance, alongside Daryl Hannah, Robert Forster and Ruben Santiago-Hudson

Found-footage horror thriller, starring Jill Larson

programme.desc: Featuring a bereaved mum trying to wrestle back control of her late son's social media accounts from a scammer, and the woman whose bank had no number for her to report a scam

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tommy and Alfie clash when Freddie lets slip who told him where to find Graham. Suki is jealous when a woman called Caz comes looking for Eve and Theo invites Stacey for a drink but is sad to discover she doesn't think of it as a date

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Lara Lewington speaks to some of the so-called godfathers of artificial intelligence about their hopes and fears for the future of a technology many believe could pose an existential threat to the human race. She also talks to researchers developing technology that allows computers to read human emotions and thoughts

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Adebanji Alade, President of the Royal Institute of Oil Painters, takes up the challenge of depicting three generations of a family who have all worked in the NHS. Grandmother Bea came to the UK as part of the Windrush generation and was employed as a health worker. Her daughter Gerrie has been a matron for 36 years, her husband Calvin retrained as a mental health nurse at the age of 49, and their three daughters all work for the NHS in Nottinghamshire, as a senior assistant in recruitment, a paediatric critical care nurse, and a student nurse

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A creepy gift from Penderecki sets Jack off in a new direction. He negotiates with the Walking Man for more information, but he won't budge until Jack has found Bear's home. He warns Jack of people in the woods who don't take kindly to police. Honey takes control of his predicament following a visit from the police, only to find it is too late and that his troubles are only just beginning

programme.desc: Spain v Sweden (Kick-off 9.00am). Coverage of the opening semi-final, which comes from Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. After eliminating reigning champions the Untied States in the last-16, Sweden produced another impressive performance as they defeated Japan 2-1 in the quarter-finals to progress to this stage. Meanwhile, Spain saw their match against Netherlands go into extra-time after conceding an equalizer in injury time, before teenage winger Salma Paralluelo came off the bench to score the winning in goal in the 111th minute

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a two bed maisonette in Westcliff on Sea, Essex and Martin Roberts is in Coleford, Gloucestershire to see a flat in need of a real renovation. Dion Dublin checks on the development of a three-bed end of terrace house in Barlaston near Stoke on Trent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers welcome a new addition to Koala Creek and do everything they can to protect the park from rabies. Kate Humble meets Emma, the archivist in Longleat's stately home, who shares one of the rarest books in the house's collection - a 400-year-old collection of Shakespeare's plays. Wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin investigates the native species in the park including various insects, fallow deer and beavers

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the ferry in Penzance to take him to the Isles of Scilly, where he learns about the islands' rich history, including one of the Royal Navy's worst shipping disasters in which 1500 men lost their lives. Later, he meets a beekeeper who is attempting to breed a native Scillonian honeybee who can deal with the harsh Atlantic climate, which inspires Rick to cook a honey pudding with Cornish ice-cream and a butterscotch sauce

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin introduces a London couple to his home town of Berkhamsted, Hertfordshire, taking them on a trip to the nearby Grand Union Canal and showcasing the local craft ales

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea gives glass-blower Mark from north Wales and potter Victor from London the opportunity to turn their hobbies into money-making businesses. After being exposed to lead poisoning as a child Mark gave up his hobby of glass-blowing and spent 35 years working in the voluntary sector but when we was made redundant, Mark put his savings into setting up his own studio and getting back into glass-blowing. Victor was introduced to pottery by an art therapist during treatment for his anxiety. His clay sculptures have artistic flair but when he adds flourishes to his tableware it takes too long to make them profitable. The pair have two months to prove they have the skill and ambition to make it at market

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team revives a German-English dictionary that belonged to a Jewish refugee nurse, a motorbike helmet and goggles and a Silver Jubilee hobby horse

programme.title: Why Buildings Collapse
programme.desc: Documentary examining the collapse of the Champlain Towers South apartment building in Miami in 2021, and looking at the implications for other buildings around the world. programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott revisits the case of 19-year-old Gaia Pope-Sutherland, highlighting her family's search for truth and justice in the wake of her untimely death from hypothermia. Gaia's alleged attacker contacted her 10 months before she went missing. As her attempts to get a restraining order were declined, her state of mind deteriorated, requiring her to be sectioned under the Mental Health Act. The inquest into Gaia's death - one of the longest in British history - revealed vital clues into her final weeks, unearthing over 50 missed opportunities in her care and search for her

There are also films from the Countryfile archives about the health-giving prowess of the UK's green havens, including John Craven finding out how nature helped heal wartime wounds, and Anita Rani visiting a special farm giving respite to refugees

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The team celebrate the wild stretch of water that is 'half mile lake' which is home to Californian sealions, African hippos and native beavers with gorillas and monkeys living on the banks. Hamza Yassin is given special access to the park after the visitors have gone home so he can capture some of the wildlife living in the lake. Kate Humble joins the vets as they check up on Wilma the cheetah who has kidney disease. Megan McCubbin visits Chico the sloth to ensure the conditions in his enclosure match the ones he would be used to in the wild

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits a Cornish dairy, and inspired by the cheese they produce, he decides to bake sumptuous cheese and chive scones. The salty old fishing town of Newlyn is Rick's next stop and the unlikely setting, perhaps, of one of Britain's most revolutionary art movements

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson travels around the Lothians with a buyer from Edinburgh who has a £360,000 budget to make a much-longed-for break from the city - and has brought her aunt along for support

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea helps artist Jack and potter Jeanet make their passions into money-making businesses. Jack is hoping to swap teaching for creating before it's too late, Dom and mentor Sharon are impressed with his multimedia artwork but are worried that he only seems to use his family as his subjects. University lecturer Jeanet struggles to find time to turn her hobby into a profession but mentor Florian thinks speed and finishing touches are what she needs to make a profit

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Stephney and Charlotte bring Charlotte's old trike, hoping restorer Tim Gunn can bring it back to life. Charlotte has wonderful childhood memories whizzing around on this trusty, yet rusty chariot, which was gifted to her by a kindly neighbour. She now has two young children of her own and would love them to enjoy it as much as she did. A silver and turquoise bracelet and a cherished pair of red ballet shoes are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda debates fighting for custody of Janine and Mick's baby and Eve goes on a date. Stacey receives another letter from her stalker and Vinny tries to convince Suki to relax. Freddie tries to play matchmaker between Anna and Bobby

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Vintage bike restorer Tim Gunn meets 80-year-old Peter Swash who brings in an ancient penny-farthing for him to repair. Having already been patched up 65-years previously when he first got the bike, Peter is hoping an expert can bring it back to life. Betty brings in a battered leather briefcase given to her as a gift for passing her engineering qualification. After spending 65 years using the briefcase while working as the first ever female member of the Institute for Structural Engineers, Betty is hoping master saddlemaker Suzie Fletcher can restore the case to its former glory. Steve Fletcher uses his expertise to repair an old clocking-on machine from the British Rail depot in Crewe but the job takes an unexpected turn when he discovers a mystery cog with no obvious place in the mechanism

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk travel to Northumbria to help retired school teachers Mike and Carole declutter their home and raise money for a trip abroad to visit their grandchild. Will quickly gets to work on some furniture in desperate need of a revamp and Christina uncovers several potentially profitable items to take to auction

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Drag artist Cheryl Hole, actor and singer Jamelia, musician Locksmith, former glamour model Sam Fox and opera singer Wynne Evans compete in the penultimate week of heats. Facing the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient they must incorporate into a dish to demonstrate their potential to judges Greg Wallace and John Torode. In a final attempt to impress, the contestants prepare their Dinner Party Dishes with hopes of not being the one person going home

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and the Gravestones
programme.desc: Radio presenter Sian Eleri investigates the paranormal activity at Penyffordd Farm in north Wales, the house being widely considered the most haunted house in Britain in the late 1990s. She begins by meeting with specialist psychologist Dr Daniels who was called in by the family living on the farm at the time when they became desperate for answers for the strange activity in their home. The doctor explains that of the many apparently paranormal cases of his career, this was the one that stayed with him and still perplexes him to this day

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and the Gravestones
programme.desc: Sian Eleri meets the current owner of Penyffordd Farm who bought the property despite the stories of its haunting. Dr Daniels suggests that moving the gravestone on the property is what started the paranormal activity, leading Sian to investigate if there really is a girl buried in the garden

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Epsom in Surrey, where the reds and the blues are led by experts Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. Plus, Eric heads to Wimbledon Common in the hope of finding out more about children's favourite the Wombles

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Hamza and the keepers get never-seen-before footage of inside the tigers' mouths in an effort to ascertain the state of their teeth. They also try to ascertain the animals' individual personality traits by onbserving the way they play with a ball. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive visits Bologna, considered by many to be Italy's food capital, where he leans to make perfect pasta and finds out why an osteria - an Italian wine bar - is superior to a pub. But it's not all food and drink as he also dons his hard hat and climbs some scaffolding to learn the history of an 800-year-old tower

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's railway journey through the Midlands and West Country takes him to Coventry, where he recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the city's gothic cathedral in November 1940. He visits the factory of the London Electric Vehicle Company, manufacturers of the iconic London taxi, and then heads south to Royal Leamington Spa and the national centre for the Guide Dogs for the Blind

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of the Russian Revolution, King Crimson, The Hunger Games, and the essays and journalism of George Orwell, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin hosts the antiques-buying challenge in which people are shown the tricks of the trade for buying and selling collectibles, before an auction showdown, with hairdresser Sarah facing off against civil servant Marika in Liverpool

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tom Westerland, Cindy Challoner and Andy Sheriden make their way to the kitchen for the Welsh heats, preparing their starters and fish courses. Tom creates a starter featuring a rabbit kiev, while Andy opts for a lamb belly dish inspired by the Welsh valleys. For her fish course, Cindy's dish features soused and grilled mackerel with beetroot and rhubarb

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his trawl through the National Archives, unearthing the secret war on the Rolling Stones, revealing how Special Branch spied on a future king. He also meets Oscar Wilde's grandson Merlin Holland to discuss the author's decline and fall from grace

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: Documentary following zookeeper Giles Clark as he hand-rears Sumatran tiger cubs Spot and Stripe, which were born at the Australia Zoo in Queensland and are one of the world's most critically endangered species. To help give them the best start and ensure their survival, Giles takes them home to live with his boisterous family and gives them round-the-clock care for the first four months of their lives. The film gives an intimate look into the crucial early development of the cubs as they struggle through their first crucial weeks, while Giles embarks upon the toughest parenting job of his life and tries to save the species from the brink of extinction in the wild. Andrew Lincoln narrates

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the Watts Gallery in Surrey, where experts Thomas Plant and David Harper are on hand to find a selection of objects to take to auction

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farming couple Robert and Catherine sell their cider for the first time at Lenham Country Market in Kent, while seasoned beekeepers Vince and Sue create a buzz with their honey

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: James and Louisa take their Jersey cows to Edenbridge and Oxted Agricultural Show, while Jill brings along her finest goats for competing

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the beautiful and unique landscapes of the Lake District, beginning by meeting Cumbrians with different visions for the future of England's biggest national park. He talks to members of a campaign group trying to protect the remaining red squirrels, a traditional farmer who feels that his ancient way of life is on the point of extinction, and an 18-year-old student who runs a 1,500-acre farm

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as Matt Groening fans the Isotopes take on teachers the Academicals. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Loretta Lynch, Matthew Hopkins, Tim Davie, and Ban Ki-moon

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Amol Rajan asks the questions in another first-round match, with students from Emmanuel College, Cambridge pitting their wits against a team from Jesus College, Oxford in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Today, Earth is home to eight billion people and counting, with humans now having a greater effect in shaping Earth's surface than many natural processes. Chris Packham explores how dramatic twists in Earth's story enabled humans to go from being part of nature to controlling it and what can be learnt from this epic tale before it's too late

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: With his daughter Denise's wedding to Dave fast approaching, the arrival of a huge phone bill is the last thing Jim needs. First episode of the comedy, starring Ricky Tomlinson, Sue Johnston, Caroline Aherne, Craig Cash and Ralf Little. First broadcast in 1998

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Piano (1993)
programme.desc: A mute Scottish widow travels to New Zealand with her daughter, and enters into a loveless arranged marriage. Her one means of self-expression is her piano, which her husband sells to a gruff settler who has adopted Maori culture. He allows her to play the instrument, and through their shared love of music, a passionate affair develops. Period drama, starring Oscar-winners Holly Hunter and Anna Paquin. With Harvey Keitel and Sam Neill

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith return to Dumfries House where the Summer activities are in full swing. Matt discovers how Dumfries House is providing local people with ways to improve mental and physical wellbeing and joins a tea dance. Charlotte visits a craft workshop to try her hand at stained glass window making, and hears about plans to re-use, refurbish and re-engineer turbines

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: As he investigates further, Jack becomes convinced the Donkey Pitch killer is still at large. In the house of horrors, Honey is paranoid they are being watched. Sophie's post-mortem reveals she was taking unprescribed antidepressants

programme.title: This Is BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hosts from an antiques fair in Detling, Kent, and discovers treasures from the ancient past. The teams receive expert help from Irita Marriott and Nick Hall

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A baby sealion's birth is caught on camera. Plus, the story of an elephant who was rescued from the circus in poor health, and is now one of the park's oldest and fittest animals

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines how when the Earth first formed from clouds of dust and gas 4.6 billion years ago, it was - like so many other lifeless worlds in the universe - devoid of an atmosphere, an inhospitable rock floating in the black void of space. However, as the young planet was pummelled by asteroids, a period of extraordinary upheaval began

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison is in Gloucestershire at Nature in Art, the world's first museum and art gallery dedicated to art inspired by nature, as she goes in search of her inner muse. While picking up a few artistic tips, Ellie introduces a selection of stories from the archives that demonstrate how the countryside has been an abiding influence, from early man to modern-day artists braving the extremes to capture a landscape or using wildlife itself to create a picture

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood gets a taste of life as a police officer in Aransas Pass on the Texas Gulf Coast, an area with a crime rate 90 per cent higher than the rest of the state

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The officers investigate the death of a five-year-old girl following an incident at a children's playground. They also clamp down on traders selling sub-standard face masks

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Kimi Raikkonen, the county of Gloucestershire, Agatha Christie's Poirot and lidos in Britain, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Antiques-buying challenge presented by Paul Martin, in which a marketing expert and a saleswoman in Stafford are shown the tricks of the trade for buying and selling collectibles

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Welsh chefs Tom Westerland, Cindy Challoner and Andy Sheridan serve up their music-themed mains and desserts, starting with an Oasis-inspired loin with rhubarb and beetroot, a beef dish named after The Cow Shed stage at Glastonbury loin and a second, more spicy beef named after a Spice Girls classic. The desserts include a symphony of chocolate and coffee in tribute to Welsh songstress Shirley Bassey and an Eton mess in homage to the Sex Pistols

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his search through the National Archives, unearthing the original letter that gave birth to Jack the Ripper, examining the mysterious disappearance of a wartime hero, and exploring the secret UFO files kept by the Ministry of Defence

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: Spot and Stripe are eight weeks old and are becoming quite a handful as they explore the Clarks' home in suburban Queensland. Giles feeds them meat, which brings out some very adult tiger behaviour, and encourages their development by allowing them outside for the first time. The zookeeper also visits the rainforest of Sumatra - the home of the tigers in the wild - to see first-hand the poaching and persecution the big cats are subjected to in their natural habitat

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Interesting finds from the show's travels on visits to Muncaster Castle in Cumbria, the Bowes Museum in Co Durham, the Grand Pier in Weston-super-Mare in Somerset and Norwich Cathedral. Items range from an art deco pair of Lalique vases to a 9.5mm projector. Presenter Paul Martin also visits Powis Castle in mid-Wales and finds out about their collection of Indian artefacts

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Newcomers Ben and Laura compete with their own flock in Tenbury Countryside Show and Vicky and Rob pick their best Border Leicester sheep to guarantee first prize

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Shropshire farmers Sarah and Paul use the milk from their dairy herd to produce traditional farmhouse cheeses and butter. In recent years they've picked up lots of awards and hope their tasty samples at the Ludlow Food Festival go down well with customers. Meanwhile, Mike, Michelle and expert hound Oscar are digging for truffles in the orchards Mike planted 15 years ago. He was hedging bets back then, but now he sells his special fungi to chefs and restaurants. Festival Day offers a chance for customers to try before they buy and Mike is on a mission to introduce truffles to a wider audience

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the impact of humans on the Lake District, discovering that the high number of visitors to Scafell Pike is damaging England's highest peak and stretching the resources of mountain rescue volunteers. He goes wild swimming in the crystal clear lake of Buttermere, before taking a look at the less-fortunate Derwent Water, one of the many lakes now clogged with invasive New Zealand pygmyweed

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Lou and Steve moved to Devon from London so their children, who are both deaf, could attend a specialist school. When they first saw the house, it wasn't love at first sight, but they decided to buy it because of its beautiful location. Now they have decided to fix the problems with their home, and they are many - from the imposing steps at the front, to the extensions causing a series of disconnected rooms. Enter architects Damion Burrows and Lizzie Fraher, who come up with alternative VR solutions to the couple's property problems. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix, Sara Davies and Raj Somaiya continue the search for someone skilled enough to launch their own wedding planning business. Rivalries grow and tensions rise as the planners have three days to create a sustainable, farmyard festival wedding for one couple and their 94 animals - and it's the final straw for one fledgling planner

programme.title: Henpocalypse!
programme.desc: Zara and her bridal party leave their Birmingham council estate for a messy hen do in an isolated Welsh cottage - only for their fun to be derailed by the end of the world. With food running out and zero survival skills to call on, the hens are forced to break quarantine and venture into post-apocalyptic Snowdonia. Comedy, starring Lucie Shorthouse, Elizabeth Berrington, Callie Cooke, Lauren O'Rourke and Kate O'Flynn

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Suburbicon (2017)
programme.desc: In the summer of 1959, a mild-mannered family man must face his demons after a home invasion shakes his quaint neighbourhood, as he has to navigate the town's dark underbelly of betrayal, deceit, and violence. Black comedy directed by George Clooney, starring Matt Damon, Julianne Moore and Oscar Isaac

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: The heartless woman who put in multiple false claims to profit from tragedies such as the Grenfell Tower fire. Plus, the brazen conman who forgot which side of his body his fake injury was on

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: TV Presenter Dave Benson Phillips, musician Max George, radio broadcaster Remi Burgz, comedian Shazia Mirza and broadcaster Terry Christian compete in a series of culinary challenges in the second week of Heats. They are each presented with a different ingredient they must use in a dish to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace in the Under The Cloche challenge. Then, the celebrities have one hour and 15 minutes to prepare a main course and dessert they would cook to impress someone at a dinner party

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Bedford to meet single mum Katie. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they transform her lacklustre bedroom into a relaxing space that doubles as a home office. Maxine Dwyer uses her potions to treat make-up spills on the carpet

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a two-bedroom maisonette in Westcliff on Sea, Essex and Martin Roberts is in Coleford, Gloucestershire to see a flat in need of a real renovation. Dion Dublin checks on the development of a three-bedroom end-of-terrace house in Barlaston near Stoke-on-Trent

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers welcome a new addition to Koala Creek and do everything they can to protect the park from rabies. Kate Humble meets Emma, the archivist in Longleat's stately home, who shares one of the rarest books in the house's collection - a 400-year-old collection of Shakespeare's plays. Wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin investigates the native species in the park including various insects, fallow deer and beavers

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Magic realist painter Belinda Eaton depicts an end-of-life care nurse at the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital, who also helps her fellow NHS staff to cope with their own bereavements. Globetrotting painter Belinda credits the experience of always being the outsider in a new place with helping her to develop a unique perspective. How will she go about depicting someone whose working life is spent on threshold between life and death?

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The endeavours of golden retriever koda, an assistance dog to Mei, who having spent much of her teen years in care suffers from anxiety issues and an eating disorder. Before Koda arrived, 20-year-old Mei was too scared to leave her home, but now they are venturing out together. Koda is prone to falling asleep on the job and has a lot to learn, so Mei has signed them up for further training to help build the confidence she needs to head from Norfolk to London to participate in a function alongside Children's Commissioner for England, Rachel de Souza

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood samples life working as a game warden in Cameron County, Texas, where he joins warden Mike Gonzalez to learn about the challenges he faces in this role

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A major incident is reported when several canisters containing the deadly chemical weapon mustard gas are dumped in a lake - and the race is on to find them

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore the potential of houses in Burton-on-Trent, Burnley and Newcastle-under-Lyme, and chat to the new owners about their plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles learns how to get started as a metal detectorist. The reds and blues are on the hunt for some profits with help from experts Charles Hanson and Nick Hall

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Stephen Sondheim musicals, dog breeds, Alan Partridge, and the Charles Paris novels by Simon Brett, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Otto von Bismarck, the history of hand-knitting, Robert Louis Stevenson, and the films of the Coen Brothers, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Southern Brave v Birmingham Phoenix (Start-time 3.00pm). Live coverage of the women's match at Ageas Bowl in Southampton. Brave were runners-up to Oval Invincibles last season, while Birmingham narrowly missed out on the knockout stage after finishing fourth in the table

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Southern Brave v Birmingham Phoenix (Start-time 6.30pm). Live coverage of the men's match at Ageas Bowl in Southampton. Both teams missed out on the play-offs last year, with Brave finishing seventh and Phoenix fourth, and Birmingham claimed a 53-run victory when the sides met at Edgbaston during that campaign. Will Smeed stole the show on that occasion when he top scored for the Phoenix with a knock of 101 not out from 50 deliveries, while Henry Brookes starred with ball by taking 5 wickets for just 25 runs

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Ahir Shah, Sara Pascoe and Suzi Ruffell join Alan Davies on the panel, as Sandi Toksvig presides and asks questions based, loosely, on the topic of 'sexed-up'

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Second of two editions featuring LGBT+ comedians who have appeared on the show, with Tom Allen, Stephen K Amos, Jen Brister, Al Porter, Julian Clary, Suzi Ruffell and Gina Yashere

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: Former care worker Georgie is given the chance to list a £15 million house, but first she has to prove her business credentials to veteran broker Danny. Ex-model Vanesa lands a 15 million euro villa overlooking Monaco, but she needs to sell it before the end of the summer or the owner will take it off the market. With only 10 days to prepare she decides to throw an open house to gain some momentum, but will the bold decision pay off and land her with an offer?

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining celebrities vie for a place in the quarter-final. Split into two pairs, they are tasked with cooking a crowd-pleasing dish that must be identical in both appearance and flavour. Only one team member has the basic instructions of how to cook the dish and has to communicate this across to get the job done. Next, the quartet cook in a professional kitchen for paying customers during a busy lunchtime service. The third and final test sees the MasterChef Kitchen transformed into a street food market, with the celebs cooking a dish that they would serve from their own dream food truck

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Reality challenge in which eight aspiring wedding planners battle it out to become the best in the business, with six brave couples letting them take control of their big day. The competition gets off to an explosive start as the planners transform an industrial Concorde hangar under the watchful eyes of judges Fred Sirieix, Sara Davies and Raj Somaiya

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: Despite a UK-wide recruitment crisis, the chef discovers how some businesses are finding clever ways to build and retain strong, effective teams. One example is found in London's Docklands and an innovative floating hotel. The owners are pioneering an on-the-job training scheme designed to help local unemployed people take their first steps into hospitality

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through New Mexico, watching rehearsals at the Santa Fe Opera House and learning about a Lancashire railroad caterer who made his fortune. He then sets off from Albuquerque to pick up Arizona's Grand Canyon Railway as heads off to witness one of the greatest sights on Earth

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Just outside Leicester, Alice joins a team of archaeologists who are investigating a mysterious mound thought to be an Iron Age hillfort, but what they unearth tells a rich story of bandits, religious crusades and connections across the medieval world. Elsewhere in Cambridge, the dig diary cameras are present to witness archaeologists unearthing an extraordinary array of exquisite artefacts from an early Anglo-Saxon cemetery

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part two of two. Anita Rani begins her own Partition journey, as she and her mother Lucky become the first members of her family to return to see what is now Pakistan, since the Partition of India. In the Punjabi village where her Sikh grandfather's first family were slaughtered, Anita meets locals who were eye witnesses to the terrible event. Across the border, Sameer Butt re-traces the epic train journey across the Punjab to Pakistan, and Binita Kane explores how her Hindu family managed to escape the violence that engulfed their Bengali village

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: An investigation into the science of black holes and the techniques being used to uncover their secrets, which in turn help to answer even bigger questions about the universe

programme.title: Shadow of Truth
programme.desc: The documentary concludes with an update to the original series. Six years on from the investigation and conviction, the Supreme Court of Israel orders a retrial and Zadorov tells his story for the first time

programme.title: Catching History's Criminals: The Forensics Story
programme.desc: Gabriel Weston explores the forensic advances that have elevated murder weapons from mere instruments to crucial pieces of evidence. She sees how arsenic, the undetectable weapon of choice in the 19th century, was exposed as the killer thanks to one simple chemical test, and finds out how distinctive marks on a victim's skull led to the weapon and, in turn, the killer. Gabriel also looks at the latest forensic developments, from 3-D laser scanning that can reconstruct the sequence of events at the scene of a gun crime to the pioneering chemistry able to determine where in the world someone has been based on just a few strands of their hair

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski explores the revolution that occurred when Einstein's theory of relativity turned Newton's elegant description of the universe inside out

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski looks back at the industrial and political revolutions of the 18th century, when the forces of nature were harnessed and the basis of political power was shifted. Human inventiveness came to full flower with the Industrial Revolution, which Bronowski claims was every bit as significant as the Renaissance

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through New Mexico, watching rehearsals at the Santa Fe Opera House and learning about a Lancashire railroad caterer who made his fortune. He then sets off from Albuquerque to pick up Arizona's Grand Canyon Railway as heads off to witness one of the greatest sights on Earth

programme.title: River Walks
programme.desc: Jemma Woodman goes on a culinary tour of the River Dart, meeting those who get inspiration and food from this scenic part of the south west of England

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Minneapolis and St Paul, where he learns how the power of the Mississippi helped Minneapolis become a great industrial centre. Later in St Paul, he explores the birthplace of F Scott Fitzgerald, and meets with a Native American expert to discover more about a dark chapter in American history

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank is given the seemingly simple task of crossing the road to call the doctor - but finds a way to bring mayhem to his mission. Betty then mistakenly locks the hapless hero out of the house, prompting a neighbour to mistake him for a burglar. Classic comedy, starring Michael Crawford

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: The visiting head of an African nation turns out to be an old college pal of Hacker - who promptly sets about trying to offload some British-made oil-rigging gear. Satirical comedy set in the world of Westminster, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: A database containing the immigration records of more than 170,000 people is accidentally erased, and Nicola and her staff try to keep the news from Malcolm. The minister also has to get through a lunch with journalists without revealing the catastrophic scale of this latest computer disaster - especially as speculation about her future has already begun. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Peter Capaldi. From October 2009

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The Regency rea is often regarded as genteel and well-ordered, with beautiful buildings, Jane Austen romance and red-coated officers defeating Napoleon at Waterloo. However, historian Lucy Worsley digs behind the facade of Georgian elegance to reveal the fibs that helped conceal a darker side to the Regency and suppressed rebellion in an age of revolution. She discovers that to quell rebellion, monarchy and government relied on spin, secrets and lies

programme.title: Queen Victoria's Letters: A Monarch Unveiled
programme.desc: Part one of two. Examining the first half of Queen Victoria's life, biographer AN Wilson goes in search of a monarch too often misunderstood as the solid black-clad matron, and reveals a woman who was passionately romantic and who spent her years as a child and young queen fighting the control of domineering men. Queen Victoria's journals and letters are read by Anna Chancellor throughout

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: Mathematician Dr Hannah Fry is joined by actor Paul McGann and psychotherapist Philippa Perry to explore the technology, art and culture of the last years of Queen Victoria's reign. In the first episode, Hannah investigates how innovations in science and technology - including the X-ray, safety bicycle and proto-aeroplane - transformed Britain in the 1890s, with the end of the 19th century marking the beginning of a new 'Electric Age'

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Minneapolis and St Paul, where he learns how the power of the Mississippi helped Minneapolis become a great industrial centre. Later in St Paul, he explores the birthplace of F Scott Fitzgerald, and meets with a Native American expert to discover more about a dark chapter in American history

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: Life in the treacherous seas that surround the South American wilderness. The 4,000-mile coast stretches from the cold waters of Cape Horn - where rockhopper penguins overcome huge challenges to raise their young - to the far north's much warmer climate, where huge elephant seals battle for position in the heat of the desert. Orcas ram-raid the beaches, grabbing seal pups to feed their young, and fishermen are also incentivised to gather the sea's bounty. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The Regency rea is often regarded as genteel and well-ordered, with beautiful buildings, Jane Austen romance and red-coated officers defeating Napoleon at Waterloo. However, historian Lucy Worsley digs behind the facade of Georgian elegance to reveal the fibs that helped conceal a darker side to the Regency and suppressed rebellion in an age of revolution. She discovers that to quell rebellion, monarchy and government relied on spin, secrets and lies

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his rail journey along the Upper Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota, and the home of Laura Ingalls Wilder, author of Little House on the Prairie. Picking up the Empire Builder rail service he travels to Winona, where he finds out how, in the 19th century, the US Army Corps of Engineers made the Mississippi navigable and how the river is maintained today

programme.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
programme.desc: The classicist takes a look at the history of the ancient city, putting aside the bloody stories of emperors and armies to learn about the ordinary Roman on the street. Her travels take her from the Via Appia roadway, originally built in 312 BC, to the Colosseum and Monte Testaccio, an artificial hill made of broken crockery. Along the way, she tells the stories of a slave-turned-baker who made a fortune out of the grain trade, building his tomb in the shape of a giant bread-oven, three prisoners of war and a purple-dye seller whose raw material was imported from Tunisia

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: Drama-documentary that uses the Colosseum to tell the thrilling story of the rise and fall of the Roman Empire, through the lens of the men and women who fought and died there. Featuring interviews with leading historians, the episode uses striking re-enactments and special effects to infuse excitement into the personal narrative of each character

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: When master builder Haterius constructs the Colosseum from the ashes of Nero's Golden House, his work is far from over. New Emperor Domitian tasks him with adding in a complex network of underground tunnels - the hypogeum

programme.title: Sir Derek Jacobi Remembers - I, Claudius
programme.desc: The veteran actor looks back at the 1970s drama, based on the novels of Robert Graves, telling the life story of a reluctant Roman emperor

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Acclaimed drama set amidst a web of power, corruption and lies, chronicling the reigns of the Roman emperors - Augustus, Tiberius, Caligula and finally Claudius - focusing on the intrigue that surrounded their respective reigns. Augustus's wife Livia schemes to ensure her son Tiberius succeeds her husband. The dispute between Marcus Agrippa and Marcellus reaches boiling point, prompting the former to leave Rome for the East. With Derek Jacobi, Sian Phillips, Brian Blessed and George Baker

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Augustus refuses to forgive Tiberius, but remains blissfully unaware of Julia's philandering. Lucius is promoted to command the army in Spain following the inexplicable death of his brother

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: A marriage is arranged for young Claudius, while Livia, wife of Emperor Augustus, plots against his daughter Julia and manages to convince him to bring her son Tiberius back from exile so he may assume the throne. As Julia is banished, stumbling, stuttering Claudius finds a friend in Herod, king of the Jews. Derek Jacobi, Sian Phillips and George Baker star

programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome little ones Dionne, Holly, Reau, Francis, Oliver and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Nigel’s bag are a red skittle, a red fire engine toy and a red ball, and all the parents and babies have different objects and toys that are red. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding a safe, baby appropriate red toy or object inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The popular baby song Little Robin Redbreast features, as does a story involving Baby Bear and Baby Tiger, and viewers at home show how they’ve been exploring red things too. The Action Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

It’s time to head back to the museum to see what Suzy and Archie make of it. Archie reveals that this object will ‘keep you safe and sound’, while Suzy finds a photo of a friend of hers with a big metal object just like the one Fred and Pete found. She sends them back to the beach to meet him. Fred and Pete arrive on the beach and are startled to see what looks like an alien with a metal object just like theirs, walking up to them. The ‘alien’ is actually Suzy's friend Iain, and he explains that the metal object on his head is a helmet for a very old-fashioned deep sea diving suit. programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher reveals the secrets of farmers and food producers as he explore Wales' best food festivals. He starts out with a visit to the Abergavenny Food Festival, where he discovers the secrets of barbecuing success from experts Sam and Shauna. Farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles with fifth-generation pickers in Carmarthenshire and Onkar Singh Purewal, a father of toddler triplets, is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tommy and Alfie clash when Freddie lets slip who told him where to find Graham. Suki is jealous when a woman called Caz comes looking for Eve and Theo invites Stacey for a drink but is sad to discover she doesn't think of it as a date

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Lara Lewington speaks to some of the so-called godfathers of artificial intelligence about their hopes and fears for the future of a technology many believe could pose an existential threat to the human race. programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Adebanji Alade, President of the Royal Institute of Oil Painters, takes up the challenge of depicting three generations of a family who have all worked in the NHS. Grandmother Bea came to the UK as part of the Windrush generation and was employed as a health worker. Her daughter Gerrie has been a matron for 36 years, her husband Calvin retrained as a mental health nurse at the age of 49, and their three daughters all work for the NHS in Nottinghamshire, as a senior assistant in recruitment, a paediatric critical care nurse, and a student nurse

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A creepy gift from Penderecki sets Jack off in a new direction. He negotiates with the Walking Man for more information, but he won't budge until Jack has found Bear's home. Honey takes control of his predicament following a visit from the police, only to find it is too late and that his troubles are only just beginning

programme.title: BBC News

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Spain v Sweden (Kick-off 9.00am). Coverage of the opening semi-final, which comes from Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. After eliminating reigning champions the Untied States in the last-16, Sweden produced another impressive performance as they defeated Japan 2-1 in the quarter-finals to progress to this stage. Meanwhile, Spain saw their match against Netherlands go into extra-time after conceding an equalizer in injury time, before teenage winger Salma Paralluelo came off the bench to score the winning in goal in the 111th minute

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a two bed maisonette in Westcliff on Sea, Essex and Martin Roberts is in Coleford, Gloucestershire to see a flat in need of a real renovation. Dion Dublin checks on the development of a three-bed end of terrace house in Barlaston near Stoke on Trent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Richard Madley and Stephanie Connell help two teams look for items at the Brackley Antiques Cellar in Northamptonshire, while presenter Eric Knowles views one of the largest shoe collections in the world

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers welcome a new addition to Koala Creek and do everything they can to protect the park from rabies. Kate Humble meets Emma, the archivist in Longleat's stately home, who shares one of the rarest books in the house's collection - a 400-year-old collection of Shakespeare's plays. Wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin investigates the native species in the park including various insects, fallow deer and beavers

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the ferry in Penzance to take him to the Isles of Scilly, where he learns about the islands' rich history, including one of the Royal Navy's worst shipping disasters in which 1500 men lost their lives. Later, he meets a beekeeper who is attempting to breed a native Scillonian honeybee who can deal with the harsh Atlantic climate, which inspires Rick to cook a honey pudding with Cornish ice-cream and a butterscotch sauce

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin introduces a London couple to his home town of Berkhamsted, Hertfordshire, taking them on a trip to the nearby Grand Union Canal and showcasing the local craft ales

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea gives glass-blower Mark from north Wales and potter Victor from London the opportunity to turn their hobbies into money-making businesses. After being exposed to lead poisoning as a child Mark gave up his hobby of glass-blowing and spent 35 years working in the voluntary sector but when we was made redundant, Mark put his savings into setting up his own studio and getting back into glass-blowing. Victor was introduced to pottery by an art therapist during treatment for his anxiety. His clay sculptures have artistic flair but when he adds flourishes to his tableware it takes too long to make them profitable. The pair have two months to prove they have the skill and ambition to make it at market

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team revives a German-English dictionary that belonged to a Jewish refugee nurse, a motorbike helmet and goggles and a Silver Jubilee hobby horse

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Lucy Porter

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the food festival at Llangollen, where local food experts reveal their passion for their produce. Onkar Singh Purewal discovers how it is possible to grow tea in the Vale of Glamorgan and farmer Meinir Howells reveals just why Welsh lamb is so popular. She also discovers the secrets of an ice cream producer in Swansea

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie and Phil work together to deal with Tommy's recent angry outbursts. Bobby asks Anna to help him arrange a surprise birthday party for Bernie but she's not convinced by his Cider, Cheese and Chess night. Eve forces Suki to see a doctor after her dizzy spell

programme.title: Why Buildings Collapse
programme.desc: Documentary examining the collapse of the Champlain Towers South apartment building in Miami in 2021, and looking at the implications for other buildings around the world. The programme explores the factors that might have led to the collapse, and also looks to the future to ask what lessons can be learnt from this disaster

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Jack unearths a clue that leads him to the Anchor-Ferrers' home. Honey makes an attempt to escape but luck is not on his side when it turns out a member of the family had been working with Molina the whole time

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Walescast
programme.desc: BBC Wales politics editor Felicity Evans and political correspondent James Williams present interviews with MPs and analysis from experts about what is happening in the world of Welsh politics

programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott revisits the case of 19-year-old Gaia Pope-Sutherland, highlighting her family's search for truth and justice in the wake of her untimely death from hypothermia. Gaia's alleged attacker contacted her 10 months before she went missing. As her attempts to get a restraining order were declined, her state of mind deteriorated, requiring her to be sectioned under the Mental Health Act. The inquest into Gaia's death - one of the longest in British history - revealed vital clues into her final weeks, unearthing over 50 missed opportunities in her care and search for her

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison explores the powers of the great outdoors to provide a tonic in troubled times as she immerses herself in nature, from forest bathing to wild swimming. There are also films from the Countryfile archives about the health-giving prowess of the UK's green havens, including John Craven finding out how nature helped heal wartime wounds, and Anita Rani visiting a special farm giving respite to refugees

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Coverage of the second semi-final (Kick-off 11.00am), which comes from Stadium Australia in Sydney. The Netherlands reached the final for the first time in their history four years ago when they claimed a 1-0 victory over Sweden after extra time

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The team celebrate the wild stretch of water that is 'half mile lake' which is home to Californian sealions, African hippos and native beavers with gorillas and monkeys living on the banks. Hamza Yassin is given special access to the park after the visitors have gone home so he can capture some of the wildlife living in the lake. Kate Humble joins the vets as they check up on Wilma the cheetah who has kidney disease. Megan McCubbin visits Chico the sloth to ensure the conditions in his enclosure match the ones he would be used to in the wild

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits a Cornish dairy, and inspired by the cheese they produce, he decides to bake sumptuous cheese and chive scones. The salty old fishing town of Newlyn is Rick's next stop and the unlikely setting, perhaps, of one of Britain's most revolutionary art movements

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson travels around the Lothians with a buyer from Edinburgh who has a £360,000 budget to make a much-longed-for break from the city - and has brought her aunt along for support

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea helps artist Jack and potter Jeanet make their passions into money-making businesses. Jack is hoping to swap teaching for creating before it's too late, Dom and mentor Sharon are impressed with his multimedia artwork but are worried that he only seems to use his family as his subjects. University lecturer Jeanet struggles to find time to turn her hobby into a profession but mentor Florian thinks speed and finishing touches are what she needs to make a profit

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Stephney and Charlotte bring Charlotte's old trike, hoping restorer Tim Gunn can bring it back to life. Charlotte has wonderful childhood memories whizzing around on this trusty, yet rusty chariot, which was gifted to her by a kindly neighbour. She now has two young children of her own and would love them to enjoy it as much as she did. A silver and turquoise bracelet and a cherished pair of red ballet shoes are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the food market in Hay-on-Wye, getting tips on home growing and finding out the secret to making fudge. Onkar Singh Purewal is in Cardiff to discover how setting up a food stall has provided a lifeline for some in the community, and in Ceredigion he discovers the key to making sourdough bread. Farmer Meinir Howells gets to grips with turning rapeseed into oil in Ruthin

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda debates fighting for custody of Janine and Mick's baby and Eve goes on a date. Stacey receives another letter from her stalker and Vinny tries to convince Suki to relax. Freddie tries to play matchmaker between Anna and Bobby

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Vintage bike restorer Tim Gunn meets 80-year-old Peter Swash who brings in an ancient penny-farthing for him to repair. Having already been patched up 65-years previously when he first got the bike, Peter is hoping an expert can bring it back to life. Betty brings in a battered leather briefcase given to her as a gift for passing her engineering qualification. After spending 65 years using the briefcase while working as the first ever female member of the Institute for Structural Engineers, Betty is hoping master saddlemaker Suzie Fletcher can restore the case to its former glory. Steve Fletcher uses his expertise to repair an old clocking-on machine from the British Rail depot in Crewe but the job takes an unexpected turn when he discovers a mystery cog with no obvious place in the mechanism

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean looks for more amusing clips in the BBC Wales TV archive to discover how hobbies, pastimes and all of the ways the Welsh have fun have been documented

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Drag artist Cheryl Hole, actor and singer Jamelia, musician Locksmith, former glamour model Sam Fox and opera singer Wynne Evans compete in the penultimate week of heats. Facing the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient they must incorporate into a dish to demonstrate their potential to judges Greg Wallace and John Torode. In a final attempt to impress, the contestants prepare their Dinner Party Dishes with hopes of not being the one person going home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and the Gravestones
programme.desc: Radio presenter Sian Eleri investigates the paranormal activity at Penyffordd Farm in north Wales, the house being widely considered the most haunted house in Britain in the late 1990s. She begins by meeting with specialist psychologist Dr Daniels who was called in by the family living on the farm at the time when they became desperate for answers for the strange activity in their home. The doctor explains that of the many apparently paranormal cases of his career, this was the one that stayed with him and still perplexes him to this day

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and the Gravestones
programme.desc: Sian Eleri meets the current owner of Penyffordd Farm who bought the property despite the stories of its haunting. Dr Daniels suggests that moving the gravestone on the property is what started the paranormal activity, leading Sian to investigate if there really is a girl buried in the garden
