Megan McCubbin visits Chico the sloth to ensure the conditions in his enclosure match the ones he would be used to in the wild

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits a Cornish dairy, and inspired by the cheese they produce, he decides to bake sumptuous cheese and chive scones. The salty old fishing town of Newlyn is Rick's next stop and the unlikely setting, perhaps, of one of Britain's most revolutionary art movements

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson travels around the Lothians with a buyer from Edinburgh who has a £360,000 budget to make a much-longed-for break from the city - and has brought her aunt along for support

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea helps artist Jack and potter Jeanet make their passions into money-making businesses. Jack is hoping to swap teaching for creating before it's too late, Dom and mentor Sharon are impressed with his multimedia artwork but are worried that he only seems to use his family as his subjects. University lecturer Jeanet struggles to find time to turn her hobby into a profession but mentor Florian thinks speed and finishing touches are what she needs to make a profit

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Stephney and Charlotte bring Charlotte's old trike, hoping restorer Tim Gunn can bring it back to life. Charlotte has wonderful childhood memories whizzing around on this trusty, yet rusty chariot, which was gifted to her by a kindly neighbour. She now has two young children of her own and would love them to enjoy it as much as she did. A silver and turquoise bracelet and a cherished pair of red ballet shoes are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Angela Rippon and Gloria Hunniford take a look at the parcel delivery company that's had a rebrand but which viewers say is still not up to scratch. Plus, the families who say they've been let down by the developers who've left playgrounds unfinished and unusable

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda debates fighting for custody of Janine and Mick's baby and Eve goes on a date. Stacey receives another letter from her stalker and Vinny tries to convince Suki to relax. Freddie tries to play matchmaker between Anna and Bobby

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Vintage bike restorer Tim Gunn meets 80-year-old Peter Swash who brings in an ancient penny-farthing for him to repair. Having already been patched up 65-years previously when he first got the bike, Peter is hoping an expert can bring it back to life. Betty brings in a battered leather briefcase given to her as a gift for passing her engineering qualification. After spending 65 years using the briefcase while working as the first ever female member of the Institute for Structural Engineers, Betty is hoping master saddlemaker Suzie Fletcher can restore the case to its former glory. Steve Fletcher uses his expertise to repair an old clocking-on machine from the British Rail depot in Crewe but the job takes an unexpected turn when he discovers a mystery cog with no obvious place in the mechanism

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk travel to Northumbria to help retired school teachers Mike and Carole declutter their home and raise money for a trip abroad to visit their grandchild. Will quickly gets to work on some furniture in desperate need of a revamp and Christina uncovers several potentially profitable items to take to auction

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Drag artist Cheryl Hole, actor and singer Jamelia, musician Locksmith, former glamour model Sam Fox and opera singer Wynne Evans compete in the penultimate week of heats. Facing the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient they must incorporate into a dish to demonstrate their potential to judges Greg Wallace and John Torode. In a final attempt to impress, the contestants prepare their Dinner Party Dishes with hopes of not being the one person going home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and the Gravestones
programme.desc: Radio presenter Sian Eleri investigates the paranormal activity at Penyffordd Farm in north Wales, the house being widely considered the most haunted house in Britain in the late 1990s. She begins by meeting with specialist psychologist Dr Daniels who was called in by the family living on the farm at the time when they became desperate for answers for the strange activity in their home. The doctor explains that of the many apparently paranormal cases of his career, this was the one that stayed with him and still perplexes him to this day

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and the Gravestones
programme.desc: Sian Eleri meets the current owner of Penyffordd Farm who bought the property despite the stories of its haunting. Dr Daniels suggests that moving the gravestone on the property is what started the paranormal activity, leading Sian to investigate if there really is a girl buried in the garden

programme.title: The Edit
programme.desc: The best of the week's entertainment news

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley visits Box Hill in Surrey to take on its zigzag cycle route - pitting himself against double Olympic gold medal-winning cyclist Joanna Rowsell Shand. Plus, there are clips from the Countryfile archives showcasing the best thrills and spills in the countryside

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood spends 24 hours working as a firefighter in Texas, but just getting the gear on in time is a tough job for him, let alone confronting his fear of heights

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A BMW driver is caught on camera dumping bags of rubbish in a fly-tipping hotspot, and pension regulators close in on a charity boss who helped himself to the company pension fund

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A tale of three mid-terraces finds Martel Maxwell in Nantwich, Cheshire, where an experienced development duo tackle a project. Martin Roberts is in Ironville just outside Nottingham to see a historic house in need of a refresh. Tommy Walsh is in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, where a young developer is taking charge for the first time under his father's supervision

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hosts from an antiques fair in Detling, Kent, and discovers treasures from the ancient past. The teams receive expert help from Irita Marriott and Nick Hall

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: A baby sealion's birth is caught on camera. Plus, the story of an elephant who was rescued from the circus in poor health, and is now one of the park's oldest and fittest animals

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef heads out from Newquay to catch Cornish king crab, then goes to Bodmin Moor to meet explorer Robin Hanbury-Tenison to find out a rewilding project on his farm for which his son Merlin has recently introduced a pair of wild beavers

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Property relocation advice programme, beginning as Steve Brown helps a couple feeling the pinch of the London property market to decide on their ideal town and the right home in which to raise their young children by showing them around Knaresborough, North Yorkshire

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Digital embroider David is hoping Dom Chinea can help him find the success his pieces deserve. Novice woodworker Rachael is hoping to find the path to success

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a 1970s electric go-kart, a wooden puzzle box and a much-loved old teddy bear with a missing leg

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Featuring a bereaved mum trying to wrestle back control of her late son's social media accounts from a scammer, and the woman whose bank had no number for her to report a scam

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tommy and Alfie clash when Freddie lets slip who told him where to find Graham. Suki is jealous when a woman called Caz comes looking for Eve and Theo invites Stacey for a drink but is sad to discover she doesn't think of it as a date

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Lara Lewington speaks to some of the so-called godfathers of artificial intelligence about their hopes and fears for the future of a technology many believe could pose an existential threat to the human race. She also talks to researchers developing technology that allows computers to read human emotions and thoughts

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Adebanji Alade, President of the Royal Institute of Oil Painters, takes up the challenge of depicting three generations of a family who have all worked in the NHS. Grandmother Bea came to the UK as part of the Windrush generation and was employed as a health worker. Her daughter Gerrie has been a matron for 36 years, her husband Calvin retrained as a mental health nurse at the age of 49, and their three daughters all work for the NHS in Nottinghamshire, as a senior assistant in recruitment, a paediatric critical care nurse, and a student nurse

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A creepy gift from Penderecki sets Jack off in a new direction. He negotiates with the Walking Man for more information, but he won't budge until Jack has found Bear's home. He warns Jack of people in the woods who don't take kindly to police. Honey takes control of his predicament following a visit from the police, only to find it is too late and that his troubles are only just beginning

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: Documentary following the regulars at a West Belfast bingo hall, as they prepare for one of the busiest nights of the year - when the prize money rises to four figures. Among the players are Eilish, who learned the game at her grandmother's knee while in her teens, Margaret, who is juggling her job, her children, a college course, and her husband's health problems, and Kate, who is preparing to celebrate a friend's birthday

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton joined by Jo Brand and Katy Balls

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present the music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show off their music knowledge are brothers Dave and Kenny from Glasgow, dad and daughter David and Aimee from Bangor, and married couple Eva and Shen from Beckenham

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Spain v Sweden (Kick-off 9.00am). Coverage of the opening semi-final, which comes from Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. After eliminating reigning champions the Untied States in the last-16, Sweden produced another impressive performance as they defeated Japan 2-1 in the quarter-finals to progress to this stage. Meanwhile, Spain saw their match against Netherlands go into extra-time after conceding an equalizer in injury time, before teenage winger Salma Paralluelo came off the bench to score the winning in goal in the 111th minute

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a two bed maisonette in Westcliff on Sea, Essex and Martin Roberts is in Coleford, Gloucestershire to see a flat in need of a real renovation. Dion Dublin checks on the development of a three-bed end of terrace house in Barlaston near Stoke on Trent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Richard Madley and Stephanie Connell help two teams look for items at the Brackley Antiques Cellar in Northamptonshire, while presenter Eric Knowles views one of the largest shoe collections in the world

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers welcome a new addition to Koala Creek and do everything they can to protect the park from rabies. Kate Humble meets Emma, the archivist in Longleat's stately home, who shares one of the rarest books in the house's collection - a 400-year-old collection of Shakespeare's plays. Wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin investigates the native species in the park including various insects, fallow deer and beavers

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the ferry in Penzance to take him to the Isles of Scilly, where he learns about the islands' rich history, including one of the Royal Navy's worst shipping disasters in which 1500 men lost their lives. Later, he meets a beekeeper who is attempting to breed a native Scillonian honeybee who can deal with the harsh Atlantic climate, which inspires Rick to cook a honey pudding with Cornish ice-cream and a butterscotch sauce

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin introduces a London couple to his home town of Berkhamsted, Hertfordshire, taking them on a trip to the nearby Grand Union Canal and showcasing the local craft ales

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea gives glass-blower Mark from north Wales and potter Victor from London the opportunity to turn their hobbies into money-making businesses. After being exposed to lead poisoning as a child Mark gave up his hobby of glass-blowing and spent 35 years working in the voluntary sector but when we was made redundant, Mark put his savings into setting up his own studio and getting back into glass-blowing. Victor was introduced to pottery by an art therapist during treatment for his anxiety. His clay sculptures have artistic flair but when he adds flourishes to his tableware it takes too long to make them profitable. The pair have two months to prove they have the skill and ambition to make it at market

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team revives a German-English dictionary that belonged to a Jewish refugee nurse, a motorbike helmet and goggles and a Silver Jubilee hobby horse

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Lucy Porter

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville ask if the banks are acting fast enough when it comes to responding to fraud

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie and Phil work together to deal with Tommy's recent angry outbursts. Bobby asks Anna to help him arrange a surprise birthday party for Bernie but she's not convinced by his Cider, Cheese and Chess night. Eve forces Suki to see a doctor after her dizzy spell

programme.title: Why Buildings Collapse
programme.desc: Documentary examining the collapse of the Champlain Towers South apartment building in Miami in 2021, and looking at the implications for other buildings around the world. The programme explores the factors that might have led to the collapse, and also looks to the future to ask what lessons can be learnt from this disaster

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Jack unearths a clue that leads him to the Anchor-Ferrers' home. Honey makes an attempt to escape but luck is not on his side when it turns out a member of the family had been working with Molina the whole time

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott revisits the case of 19-year-old Gaia Pope-Sutherland, highlighting her family's search for truth and justice in the wake of her untimely death from hypothermia. Gaia's alleged attacker contacted her 10 months before she went missing. As her attempts to get a restraining order were declined, her state of mind deteriorated, requiring her to be sectioned under the Mental Health Act. The inquest into Gaia's death - one of the longest in British history - revealed vital clues into her final weeks, unearthing over 50 missed opportunities in her care and search for her

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League star Joleon Lescott, long jump Commonwealth medallist Jazmin Sawyers, London 2012 bronze medal-winning boxer Anthony Ogogo, and athlete Keely Hodgkinson join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison explores the powers of the great outdoors to provide a tonic in troubled times as she immerses herself in nature, from forest bathing to wild swimming. There are also films from the Countryfile archives about the health-giving prowess of the UK's green havens, including John Craven finding out how nature helped heal wartime wounds, and Anita Rani visiting a special farm giving respite to refugees

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Coverage of the second semi-final (Kick-off 11.00am), which comes from Stadium Australia in Sydney. The Netherlands reached the final for the first time in their history four years ago when they claimed a 1-0 victory over Sweden after extra time

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: The farmyard bunch play hide-and-seek and Muireall is the winner as she can’t be found - she has the best hiding place of all

programme.title: Su Pic (Peek Zoo)
programme.desc: When Wendy finds a nightingale with a broken wing, she brings the bird to Sù Pìc

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: When AH-AH wakes up with a pain in his bill, he and his friend try to find a remedy as he is afraid to get it seen

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: The duo teach Jamila how to slide down on a sledge but they don’t agree with one another because they aren’t listening properly

programme.title: Rita is Crogall
programme.desc: Rita and Crocodile spend the day on the beach finding lots of shells and beautiful pebbles

programme.title: Meaban is Moo
programme.desc: Linda visits Meaban and Moo at their hut to set them a number of fun challenges

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Siobhan MacInnes reads Bilidh agus an Dràgon, written by Nadia Shireen and translated into Gaelic by Donald John MacLeod

programme.title: Port Pàipeir
programme.desc: A special two-part episode which delves into the past and backstory of Curlybeard 110 years ago, when he was just a child in Paper Port

programme.title: Damhan & Durrag/Pipas & Douglas
programme.desc: Somebody is desperate for a rain shower

programme.title: Alba Eagalach
programme.desc: The CBBC ALBA team learn about life in the 17th century on a visit to Mary King's Close in Edinburgh

programme.title: Bogaisean is Gumbalan/Bottersnikes and Gumbles
programme.desc: Chank, Glob and Snorg go on a mission to find out information about what the Gumbals are doing, the Gumbal Aognachail appears to protect the Gumbals

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: There's lots of fun happening in the shot put

programme.title: Na Dana-thursan aig Tintin/The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: When the Emir's son is saved from Muller, the detectives swallow pills for their headaches. They are not headache tablets but Formula Fourteen - pills used to sabotage the world's oil supply

programme.title: An Solas Buan (Lighthouses of Scotland)
programme.desc: The work of lighthouse architects Tom and David Stevenson, whose designs moved more toward functionality and away from the fancy flourishes that characterised their predecessors. programme.desc: Using dramatic reconstructions and expert opinion, John Morrison revisits the story of Eugene Chantrelle, a French teacher hanged for murdering his wife in Edinburgh in 1878. A gifted linguist with medical knowledge, he frequently threatened to poison his wife - and was accused of so doing upon her death. Chantrelle pleaded his innocence up to the moment he was hanged and the evidence against him was circumstancial - and his great-grandson speaks of the lasting damage caused to the family

programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two men, both of them born in Ireland to unmarried mothers at a time when having children outside of marriage was seen as sinful and the Catholic Church went to great lengths to cover it up. When Arthur Fitzharris's adoptive parents died he decided to find out about his birth family, and was dismayed to discover that his birth certificate falsely recorded early foster parents as though they were his biological parents. Bernard McGrath discovered his adoptive parents were falsely named as his biological parents on his birth certificate and no other records seemed available to him

Against all the odds, Omid's acting career flourished and his credits range from Hollywood films to the West End stage, and he tells Kate why he made the important decision to continue writing jokes about race and religion, even when his own personal safety was under threat

programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two men, both of them born in Ireland to unmarried mothers at a time when having children outside of marriage was seen as sinful and the Catholic Church went to great lengths to cover it up. When Arthur Fitzharris's adoptive parents died he decided to find out about his birth family, and was dismayed to discover that his birth certificate falsely recorded early foster parents as though they were his biological parents. Bernard McGrath discovered his adoptive parents were falsely named as his biological parents on his birth certificate and no other records seemed available to him

programme.desc: A secret from Jean's past resurfaces when the wife of an ex-lover turns up at the hospital and makes an accusation. programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Weatherill and Sister Brigid take the Ormerod children on a family day out to Peasholm Park to see a naval re-enactment show, but the trip ends in disaster. Meanwhile, Dr Ellis risks getting too involved with a patient who is in trouble with the law, and Lizzie sets out to improve her career prospects. Starring Amy Robbins, Linda Armstrong, Neil McDermott and Michelle Hardwick

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Walker is forced to confront his past when he undertakes his own unofficial investigation into a series of violent robberies around Aidensfield. Helen has to come to terms with the fact that her marriage is probably over when Matthew's mistress appears in the village, and David finds himself involved in some shady behaviour. Jonathan Kerrigan, Sophie Ward, Oliver Montgomery and David Lonsdale star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy and Walker hunt for a batch of stolen Russian icons, and suspect the victim of an assault at the Aidensfield Arms might be involved when they discover his criminal connections. Vernon embarks on another hare-brained scheme when he meets an Italian truffle salesman, while Helen is puzzled by a youngster's baffling medical history. Guest starring David Dickinson as antiques dealer Crispin Jones, with Mark Jordon, Jonathan Kerrigan and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Emily offers comfort when an anguished Marlon breaks down, but he misreads her motherly gesture. Baby Noah continues to fight for survival

programme.desc: Charity finally discovers the identity of Noah's father, Donna receives disturbing news in the post and Jarvis makes a shocking discovery about Edna's grandmother on the internet

programme.desc: Gossip spreads like wildfire after Curly locks Emma out of the house, and Sunita thinks she has been stood up by Dev

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Dour DI Jack Frost suspects a man he arrested years before for a series of bizarre assaults on children could have returned to the area and recommenced his unsavoury activities. He tracks down the culprit, who swears he has turned over a new leaf, and decides not to charge him - a decision that shocks fellow sleuth DS Maud, whose misgivings are later justified in tragic fashion. Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: New broom Sgt Miller (John Duttine) introduces a rapid response car but his big city ideas receive a cool reception from the Aidensfield watch. Walker is beaten up by hoodlums but falls for nurse Clare Owen during his stay in hospital

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Walker receives a tempting offer from an old friend, but as the proposition involves a spot of rule-bending on his part, the decision to go through with it could land him in serious trouble, especially as Sgt Miller already seems less than impressed by the policeman's rebellious nature. Rural drama starring, Jonathan Kerrigan, John Duttine and Mark Jordon

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The newly promoted Detective Sergeant Morse investigates when a famous international thief tries to steal a Faberge egg from an auction. The case leads to the gruesome murders of an academic and a gangster, and Morse is convinced the deaths are the work of the same man. As he struggles with his new responsibilities, he finds himself forced to mentor a younger partner (played by Poldark's Lewis Peek)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A man is found shot dead in a hotel room and the cash he was carrying has gone missing. Ronnie and Sam discover the victim owed his ex-wife thousands of pounds in child support for their terminally ill son and had been lying to his girlfriend about his line of work. As the investigation progresses, the detectives focus their inquiries on the child's grandfather. Did he commit murder to recoup the unpaid money or is there more to this family set-up than first appears? Meanwhile, at the Crown Prosecution Service, Kate and Jake work out their differences. Guest starring Ian Bleasdale (Casualty)

programme.desc: A woman's body is pulled from the river, reminding Frost that he investigated the death of her husband's first wife years ago. Discreetly continuing his enquiries, he is intrigued to learn the local priest recently heard a very disturbing confession. Starring David Jason, Eoin McCarthy, Anthony Calf, Kenneth Cope and Isla Blair

Rural drama, guest starring James Weaver, with Mark Jordon, Geoffrey Hughes and John Duttine

programme.desc: Clare finds herself under suspicion when a wild party ends in tragedy with a drugs-related death, and David is put in a tricky situation when his Aunty Peggy arrives in Aidensfield and sets up an illegal vodka still

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's the day of the Little Crosby Folk Festival and organiser Toby Winning is found dead, having drowned in a bowl of eggs and live eels. The murder seems to have been inspired by a ballad made famous by the late, lamented star Johnny Carver. Then it comes to light the victim recently announced plans to move the event to a new location, which would have cost local entrepreneur Frank Wainwright dearly. Toby's estranged wife Alice also comes under suspicion, before two further killings take place, echoing more lyrics from the song

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Sam lead the investigation into the death of a wealthy woman whose body was dumped in the Thames. The team initially focuses inquiries on the victim's abusive ex-husband, with whom she had been involved in a bitter struggle over custody of their daughter Holly, but the case heads in a different direction when the detectives discover the teenager was infatuated with her mother's new partner. With Patrick Baladi and an appearance by Bradley Walsh's son Barney

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Cassie and Sunny go in search of Hayley's family as the press begin to take an interest in the story. A detective who was involved in the original investigation offers his thoughts on why her disappearance remained unsolved, pointing out that Hayley's boyfriend was suspected of the crime but was never charged. The distance between where Hayley was last seen and where her body was found leads Cassie to form a new theory - that the killer may have travelled up from London, then returned before they could be questioned

programme.desc: Dev piles the pressure on Sunita to marry him and become the mother of his children, Mike stops Joe and Karen in their tracks and Les is pleased to hear about the Watts' split

programme.desc: Katy is devastated when Martin tells her to stop pestering him, and Deirdre questions Tracy about the identity of her new mystery man

programme.desc: Pawnbroker Peter Lawson is shot dead in an armed robbery at his premises and Frost's investigations unearth a tragic family secret. David Jason stars, with Diane Keen, Isla Blair, Matt Bardock, Anthony Bate, Mark Lambert and Edward Purver

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A crime wave hits Ashfordly train station as a number of freight wagons mysteriously vanish, giving the police a tricky case to crack, but a sandwich could provide a vital clue. Peggy has plans to make some fast money when she decides to play dirty in the local bowls tournament, while a night out in Whitby proves eventful for Walker and Helen. Rural drama, starring Gwen Taylor, Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl is injured in a horse riding accident, leading the police to stumble upon a sinister series of animal thefts. Helen tries to tell Rob she doesn't want a relationship with him, but worries about hurting his feelings. Meanwhile, Oscar catches Peggy and David hosting a poker tournament in the Aidensfield Arms and bars them from the pub. Rural drama starring Sophie Ward, Derek Fowlds, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when the body of a wildlife ranger is found on a remote island off the coast of Northumberland. Her death is at first assumed to be an accident, since she was alone on the island when she died, but marks on the body seem to point to murder. As Vera delves into the dead woman's personal life, she uncovers dark secrets and old resentments

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: An elderly woman is found dead in her flat after a break-in, leading Ronnie and Sam to suspect a burglary gone wrong. However, following a tip-off from the victim's grand-daughter Connie, the detectives' attention turns to live-in carer Cecile, who is promptly arrested. But the accused points the finger back at Connie, claiming she had been deliberately starving her grandmother. Who will the team believe? With Jan Francis, Daniel Casey and Ramon Tikaram

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Pete, Chris, James and Tim are all interviewed by Cassie and Sunny about the time they spent renting a holiday cottage near where Hayley disappeared over the turn of the millennium. He recalls seeing press coverage of Hayley's disappearance, but never having seen her in person. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Walker is forced to confront his past when he undertakes his own unofficial investigation into a series of violent robberies around Aidensfield. Helen has to come to terms with the fact that her marriage is probably over when Matthew's mistress appears in the village, and David finds himself involved in some shady behaviour. Jonathan Kerrigan, Sophie Ward, Oliver Montgomery and David Lonsdale star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy and Walker hunt for a batch of stolen Russian icons, and suspect the victim of an assault at the Aidensfield Arms might be involved when they discover his criminal connections. Vernon embarks on another hare-brained scheme when he meets an Italian truffle salesman, while Helen is puzzled by a youngster's baffling medical history. Guest starring David Dickinson as antiques dealer Crispin Jones, with Mark Jordon, Jonathan Kerrigan and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Emily offers comfort when an anguished Marlon breaks down, but he misreads her motherly gesture. Baby Noah continues to fight for survival

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Dour DI Jack Frost suspects a man he arrested years before for a series of bizarre assaults on children could have returned to the area and recommenced his unsavoury activities. He tracks down the culprit, who swears he has turned over a new leaf, and decides not to charge him - a decision that shocks fellow sleuth DS Maud, whose misgivings are later justified in tragic fashion. Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: New broom Sgt Miller (John Duttine) introduces a rapid response car but his big city ideas receive a cool reception from the Aidensfield watch. Walker is beaten up by hoodlums but falls for nurse Clare Owen during his stay in hospital

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Walker receives a tempting offer from an old friend, but as the proposition involves a spot of rule-bending on his part, the decision to go through with it could land him in serious trouble, especially as Sgt Miller already seems less than impressed by the policeman's rebellious nature. Rural drama starring, Jonathan Kerrigan, John Duttine and Mark Jordon

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The newly promoted Detective Sergeant Morse investigates when a famous international thief tries to steal a Faberge egg from an auction. The case leads to the gruesome murders of an academic and a gangster, and Morse is convinced the deaths are the work of the same man. As he struggles with his new responsibilities, he finds himself forced to mentor a younger partner (played by Poldark's Lewis Peek)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A man is found shot dead in a hotel room and the cash he was carrying has gone missing. Ronnie and Sam discover the victim owed his ex-wife thousands of pounds in child support for their terminally ill son and had been lying to his girlfriend about his line of work. As the investigation progresses, the detectives focus their inquiries on the child's grandfather. Did he commit murder to recoup the unpaid money or is there more to this family set-up than first appears? Meanwhile, at the Crown Prosecution Service, Kate and Jake work out their differences. Guest starring Ian Bleasdale (Casualty)

programme.desc: A woman's body is pulled from the river, reminding Frost that he investigated the death of her husband's first wife years ago. Discreetly continuing his enquiries, he is intrigued to learn the local priest recently heard a very disturbing confession. Starring David Jason, Eoin McCarthy, Anthony Calf, Kenneth Cope and Isla Blair

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy tries to impress Miller by going it alone, while the arrival of tax inspector Derek Ford gets the residents of Aidensfield panicked. Vernon bears the brunt of Ford's wrath when his dodgy dealings and poor record-keeping are exposed, convincing the wheeler dealer the only way to avoid trouble is to fake his own suicide. Rural drama, guest starring James Weaver, with Mark Jordon, Geoffrey Hughes and John Duttine

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's the day of the Little Crosby Folk Festival and organiser Toby Winning is found dead, having drowned in a bowl of eggs and live eels. The murder seems to have been inspired by a ballad made famous by the late, lamented star Johnny Carver. Then it comes to light the victim recently announced plans to move the event to a new location, which would have cost local entrepreneur Frank Wainwright dearly. Toby's estranged wife Alice also comes under suspicion, before two further killings take place, echoing more lyrics from the song

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Sam lead the investigation into the death of a wealthy woman whose body was dumped in the Thames. The team initially focuses inquiries on the victim's abusive ex-husband, with whom she had been involved in a bitter struggle over custody of their daughter Holly, but the case heads in a different direction when the detectives discover the teenager was infatuated with her mother's new partner. With Patrick Baladi and an appearance by Bradley Walsh's son Barney

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Cassie and Sunny go in search of Hayley's family as the press begin to take an interest in the story. A detective who was involved in the original investigation offers his thoughts on why her disappearance remained unsolved, pointing out that Hayley's boyfriend was suspected of the crime but was never charged. The distance between where Hayley was last seen and where her body was found leads Cassie to form a new theory - that the killer may have travelled up from London, then returned before they could be questioned

programme.desc: Dev piles the pressure on Sunita to marry him and become the mother of his children, Mike stops Joe and Karen in their tracks and Les is pleased to hear about the Watts' split

programme.desc: Katy is devastated when Martin tells her to stop pestering him, and Deirdre questions Tracy about the identity of her new mystery man

programme.desc: Pawnbroker Peter Lawson is shot dead in an armed robbery at his premises and Frost's investigations unearth a tragic family secret. David Jason stars, with Diane Keen, Isla Blair, Matt Bardock, Anthony Bate, Mark Lambert and Edward Purver

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A crime wave hits Ashfordly train station as a number of freight wagons mysteriously vanish, giving the police a tricky case to crack, but a sandwich could provide a vital clue. Peggy has plans to make some fast money when she decides to play dirty in the local bowls tournament, while a night out in Whitby proves eventful for Walker and Helen. Rural drama, starring Gwen Taylor, Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl is injured in a horse riding accident, leading the police to stumble upon a sinister series of animal thefts. Helen tries to tell Rob she doesn't want a relationship with him, but worries about hurting his feelings. Meanwhile, Oscar catches Peggy and David hosting a poker tournament in the Aidensfield Arms and bars them from the pub. Rural drama starring Sophie Ward, Derek Fowlds, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when the body of a wildlife ranger is found on a remote island off the coast of Northumberland. Her death is at first assumed to be an accident, since she was alone on the island when she died, but marks on the body seem to point to murder. As Vera delves into the dead woman's personal life, she uncovers dark secrets and old resentments

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: An elderly woman is found dead in her flat after a break-in, leading Ronnie and Sam to suspect a burglary gone wrong. However, following a tip-off from the victim's grand-daughter Connie, the detectives' attention turns to live-in carer Cecile, who is promptly arrested. But the accused points the finger back at Connie, claiming she had been deliberately starving her grandmother. Who will the team believe? With Jan Francis, Daniel Casey and Ramon Tikaram

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Pete, Chris, James and Tim are all interviewed by Cassie and Sunny about the time they spent renting a holiday cottage near where Hayley disappeared over the turn of the millennium. James is the first to be called in, and reveals that Tim and Chris both had their families with them at the time. He recalls seeing press coverage of Hayley's disappearance, but never having seen her in person. Meanwhile, Chris is looking at flats with Jamila, who resolves that she needs to know everything about his past before she will take their relationship further

They still have to recuperate Hammy, so Mo and Sam do their best to control their troublesome (and fairly useless) power at school, where they provoke a series of catastrophes.

programme.desc: When Shaggy and Scooby are excited to visit a scary haunted old castle in Germany the rest of the gang are confused until they meet up with none other than famous chef writer and TV presenter Alton Brown! Shaggy Scooby and Alton are good friends (mostly because they will happily eat any experimental scientific food experiment Alton comes up with). Alton Brown is on the trail of his ancestor mad scientist Dr. Cornelius Frankenfooder! It's said he made a crazy Monster from animated foodstuffs that haunts this old castle to this day. Mr. Brown has to get to the bottom of this familial mystery. Obviously our gang is on board to help. Come for the kooky scientific food creations. Stay for the horrible monster! It's definitely a mystery our gang can sink their teeth into…hopefully before the monster sinks its teeth into our gang!

programme.title: The 1970s Supermarket
programme.desc: The story of the shopping revolution, as Britain went from small behind-the-counter shops to massive megastores, with trolleys, booze sections and barcodes. The first episode reveals how the nation went crazy for convenience food, which back then came in cans, such as wartime favourite Spam. Chris Clarke also whisks up the fluffy dessert Angel Delight, and the programme explores how the rise of the home freezer heralded the birth of frozen food chains Iceland and Bejam

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: Return of the documentary following the work of medical staff at Stoke's Royal University Hospital, as they strive to save the lives of sick and injured patients. A one-punch attack in the street leaves a man with a potentially devastating head injury, and trauma team leader Richard quickly realises he needs to perform emergency surgery on a bleed inside his brain. A young man arrives with multiple broken bones and suspected internal injuries following a motorbike accident, while a factory worker hopes the team can save his arm after a horrific accident with a circular saw

programme.desc: An evil genius finally succeeds in killing the superhero who has foiled his every evil scheme, but finds life without an enemy boring. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Brad Pitt

Comedy based on the TV series, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn, Bill Pertwee, Ian Lavender and Arnold Ridley

programme.title: Steel Magnolias (1989)
programme.desc: The close friendship of six women from different generations, living in a backwoods town in America's Deep South, sustains them through life's joys and disappointments. Drama based on the play by Robert Harling, starring Sally Field, Julia Roberts, Dolly Parton, Shirley MacLaine, Olympia Dukakis, Daryl Hannah and Sam Shepard

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level (2019)
programme.desc: Players of Jumanji return, but as they attempt to rescue one of their own, they will have to brave parts unknown from arid deserts to snowy mountains, to escape the world's most dangerous game. Director Jake Kasdan's fantasy adventure sequel to his 2017 rebooted hit Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: Kes (1969)
programme.desc: A shy boy in a northern mining town finds his dreary and depressing life taking on a deeper meaning when he finds a baby kestrel and decides to keep it as a pet. Ken Loach's British drama, starring David Bradley, Colin Welland, Lynne Perrie, Freddie Fletcher and Brian Glover

programme.title: Bread and Roses (2000)
programme.desc: Two Mexican sisters working as cleaners in Los Angeles realise they are being exploited by their employers. Their lives are turned upside down as they become involved in the fight for recognition and the right for union representation, with the help of a political activist. Drama, starring Pilar Padilla, Adrien Brody and Elpidia Carrillo

programme.title: Rugrats in Paris (2000)
programme.desc: The lucky little tots embark on a trip to a French theme park - but while the rest of the gang are intent on enjoying themselves, Chuckie is distracted by his wish for a new mum. He sets his sights on the owner of the amusement park as a prospective partner for his single dad. Animated adventure, with the voices of Christine Cavanaugh, Elizabeth Daily, Cheryl Chase, Kath Soucie and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: Home Alone (1990)
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine O'Hara and John Candy

programme.title: Crack in the World (1965)
programme.desc: A dying scientist and his colleagues conduct experiments to harness the Earth's inner energy that seem set to end in disaster. Sci-fi thriller, with Dana Andrews, Janette Scott, Kieron Moore and Alexander Knox

programme.title: First Men in the Moon (1964)
programme.desc: An eccentric Victorian inventor discovers a strange material that defies gravity and uses it to build the world's first spaceship. Leading an expedition to the moon, he is astonished to discover it is inhabited by giant ants and caterpillar-like creatures. Sci-fi adventure based on HG Wells' novel, starring Lionel Jeffries, Edward Judd, Martha Hyer and Miles Malleson, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Gods of Egypt (2016)
programme.desc: An ancient Egyptian god is driven into exile when his evil brother murders their father and seizes his throne. He enlists the aid of a human thief in restoring justice, and in return offers to help the mortal to bring his murdered lover back to life. Fantasy adventure, starring Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Brenton Thwaites, Gerard Butler and Chadwick Boseman

programme.title: The Lincoln Lawyer (2011)
programme.desc: A cynical lawyer who operates out of his car takes on the profitable case of defending a rich man accused of rape. However, he begins to suspect his client may be guilty of not only this attack, but an earlier rape case for which another man is currently in prison. Thriller, starring Matthew McConaughey, Marisa Tomei, Ryan Phillippe and William H Macy

programme.title: Sicario 2: Soldado (2018)
programme.desc: The drug war on the US-Mexico border has escalated as the cartels have begun trafficking terrorists across the US border. Federal agent Matt Graver re-teams with operative Alejandro Gillick to fight the enemy forces. Thriller sequel, starring Josh Brolin, Benicio Del Toro and Isabela Moner

programme.title: The Untouchables (1987)
programme.desc: Incorruptible federal agent Eliot Ness is assigned the task of fighting organised crime in Prohibition-era Chicago and bringing the notorious crime boss Al Capone to justice. Aware crooked police are undermining his investigations, he puts together his own elite squad to take on the Mob. Brian De Palma's crime thriller, with Kevin Costner, Robert De Niro, Andy Garcia and Sean Connery, who won an Oscar for his performance

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs (2009)
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Patrick (2018)
programme.desc: A young woman's chaotic life becomes more complicated when she inherits her grandmother's dog. Comedy, starring Beattie Edmondson, Ed Skrein, Jennifer Saunders and Cherie Lunghi

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts (1963)
programme.desc: The son of an overthrown king must embark on an epic sea voyage in search of the fabled Golden Fleece so he can return and reclaim his kingdom. Before he can seize the treasure, he has to overcome a series of horrific creatures, including a seven-headed monster and a horde of sword-wielding skeletons. Mythological fantasy adventure, starring Todd Armstrong, Honor Blackman, Nancy Kovack, Niall MacGinnis and Patrick Troughton, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Men in Black (1997)
programme.desc: A streetwise cop is enlisted by a top-secret government force dedicated to policing alien visitors to Earth, teaming up with a veteran agent just as a body-swapping extraterrestrial giant insect begins a reign of terror throughout New York City. Sci-fi comedy, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, Rip Torn and Vincent D'Onofrio

programme.title: Men in Black II (2002)
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: The Godfather (1972)
programme.desc: The patriarch of the Corleone crime family is hospitalised after an attempt on his life and entrusts control of his business to his three sons - the violent and unpredictable Sonny, the weak-willed Fredo, and Michael, the youngest brother, who reluctantly takes up the reins but proves to be the most ruthless of them all. Francis Ford Coppola's gangster drama, starring Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Robert Duvall and Diane Keaton

programme.title: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1988)
programme.desc: While investigating the shooting of a colleague, disaster-prone police lieutenant Frank Drebin uncovers a plot to assassinate the Queen during her visit to Los Angeles. However, after he is sacked from the force by the mayor, the cop has to operate beneath the radar to get to the bottom of the conspiracy. Comedy, with Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley and Ricardo Montalban

programme.title: P'Tang Yang Kipperbang (1982)
programme.desc: A 14-year-old schoolboy Alan struggles to cope with growing up in the post-war period. He becomes infatuated with a classmate but is too shy to do anything about it. When he learns he will have to kiss her in the school play, he is terrified at the prospect. Director Michael Apted's comedy drama, starring John Albasiny, Alison Steadman, Abigail Cruttenden and Robert Urquhart

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Goldie receives some bad news and Warren and Ella bond when they receive an uninvited visitor at the garage. Darren comes clean to Charlie about what the doctor said

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Things get ugly between James and the McQueens when Ste takes things into his own hands. Mercedes receives a shocking call and Warren makes a decision. Ethan tries to show Sienna that he trusts her and Charlie opens up to Shing Lin

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Queens, New York, where he meets a family torn apart by the stress of running failing Greek restaurant Kati Allo. Husband-and-wife owners Manny and Christine are on the brink of divorce, while their daughter Evelyn is caught in the middle and at her wits' end

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of Mangia Mangia, an Italian restaurant with an identity crisis in Woodland Park, Colorado, where guests have a choice between casual fine-dining service or a pick-up from the drive-through takeaway. Hard-nosed owner Julie finds herself completely at odds with the head chef, forcing her to breaking point

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Georgie struggles with his big secret, Sheldon copes with the death of a hero and Missy wants to babysit

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

Determined to crack the case, he enlists Santiago and Holt to help uncover more evidence - and risks suspension as a result. Boyle is devastated when Vivian ends their relationship, so his colleagues try to cheer him up

Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.title: The Neighborhood

programme.title: The Neighborhood

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay is troubled when best pal Shorty reveals that he and his wife are moving away. Phil and Claire take Haley out to discuss her future, while Mitchell and Cam take a break from all the wedding planning to enjoy a romantic meal - only to interrupt a couple's surprise engagement dinner. Chazz Palminteri and Jennifer Tilly guest star

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After a sleepless night, Leonard breaks his room-mate agreement with Sheldon. Howard makes preparations to go on a flight to the International Space Station and enlists Raj's help to ensure he gets a cool astronaut nickname

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon uses his holidays to help Amy in her biology lab, but moans about the menial jobs he is given - until she asks him to dissect a brain. Penny grows curious about Leonard's attitude to marriage when Bernadette asks Howard to sign a pre-nuptial agreement

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy try to eliminate stress from the planning of their wedding by applying mathematics to the process. Meanwhile, Raj 'breaks up' with Howard after realising that his best friend is actually damaging his confidence

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Black-ish

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft

They have a budget of £75,000, so Jasmine locates five options to the pair to consider

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The return of the programme following British expats as they set up new businesses in France, Spain, Italy and Portugal. A London couple roll out plans for their new motorhome business in France, while in Spain, a couple work hard to fill their empty guest house

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more items to fix up and sell on, visiting the Isle of Wight to meet a couple who have lots of unwanted militaria in their sheds. While Henry embarks on an ambitious project to turn y tank parts into hanging baskets, Simon plans to transform old insulators into studio flat lighting

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Cumbria, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit collector Paula, who badly needs some cash to fix her leaking roof. Henry picks a Morris Minor for restoration, while Simon turns some unwanted wood into furniture that seriously impresses independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers try to establish the value of a Lincolnshire railway man's estate by visiting his last known address, and uncover the story of his military service in Aden, Yemen. Meanwhile, another case is complicated by a family's numerous name changes. Plus, details of more unclaimed estates are divulged

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Owner Alfie Bubbles and former Brookside star Philip Olivier welcome guests to a Beatles-themed hotel - The Yellow Submarine - in Liverpool. However, one guest is unimpressed when she falls ill on a sea voyage, and breakfast turns into a comedy of errors

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Megan Edgcumbe and Dick Stanley host the latest round of the competition at Manor Lodge in Cornwall. Things get off to a good start when the guests find their rooms clean, but later the hostess reveals her upper-class background and a Cumberland sausage causes a stir at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: James and Judith Calderbank invite their fellow competitors to the rural Ashculme House in Devon for the third visit of the week, but the couple's back-to-basics approach does not go down well with all the guests. Workaholic Alfie worries that having no phone signal will affect his business, while competitive Megan and Dick relish finding dust in the outside building

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competitors have great expectations of Kevin Wainwright and partner David Little's Satis House in Suffolk, but the last visit of the week sees old resentments resurface as Megan and Dick eagerly point out faults in the hosts' presentation - including an oversight in their room and overly crispy bacon for breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It

Matt loves it but Lucia does not, so while Kirstie Allsopp tries to change the layout, Phil Spencer finds some alternative properties. But will the family choose to up sticks or stay where they are?

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow adolescent babirusa Tolo, who lives with his devoted mother Sula. They are very close, enjoying mud baths and pedicures together. But Sula has a hoof problem so they must be separated for the vet to intervene, and keepers are concerned for Tolo's wellbeing in her absence. Meanwhile, laid-back rock hyraxes Daissie and her partner Nungu are expecting their eighth litter. With the birth imminent, the couple's life of ease could be a thing of the past

programme.title: The Dog House Australia

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

Meanwhile, 58-year-old lung cancer patient Terry is in A&E with his carer Sandy, a year after being given two weeks to live

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Portugal, holiday village owners rush to get ready in time for their first guests, while a motorhome rental business in France encounters some technical difficulties

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Suffolk, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet former agony aunt Janet, whose garden shed is crammed with goodies. With no motors to unearth, Henry makes a rare furniture discovery, while Simon finds a vintage tram bench

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: On the Isle of Wight, Henry Cole finds an unusual three-wheeled motorbike and Simon O'Brien unearths an old projector screen that he wants to turn into a work of art

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers are on the rock in Ireland, searching for the beneficiaries to the estate of a Limerick-born man. Another case reveals the compulsive hoarding habits of a car enthusiast, and uncovers a potentially highly valuable collection of Dinky toys. Meanwhile, the work of the team brings about an emotional family reunion

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Wizards Thatch in Alderley Edge, a village in Cheshire. Owners Ian Lambert and his partner Ali Imiolek hope to cast a spell over the competition, but their guests end up picking out problems with the continental breakfast basket

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Blackpool, where James Reay and Simon Dooley run the one-star Winterbourne Hotel and Theatre Showbar. The contestants seem to be relaxed and impressed, but a rival's feedback sends one of the hosts storming out of the room

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Perfectionist Andrea Hickmott and her partner Nick Bonner-Williams welcome their guests to Northrise Lodge in Hastings, East Susses, but the rooms are criticised and deemed too clinical to relax in. Andrea also panics when she forgets to put sugar on the tables at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Stephanie and Dominic Parker (who would go on to find fame in Gogglebox) welcome the rest of the contestants to their B&B, the Salutation in Sandwich, Kent. However, an alcohol-fuelled evening of parlour games jeopardises the hosts' chances to win the prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. A wedding proposal appears to be on the cards, and the winner is announced

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet a couple of doctors in need of a property re-think. Their three-bedroom Victorian semi in Newcastle is not working for them and their two young daughters. Kathleen loves the location and reckons the house could be made to work, but Tom wants to sell up and pursue a better life in the country.

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The fly-on-the-cage-wall documentary returns, with more stories about the animals of Chester Zoo. The keepers suspect Margery the Malayan tapir may be eating for two, while James Bond the macaw is put into quarantine to ensure he does not have the same disease that killed his partner, Miss Moneypenny. The tiny but mighty golden mantella frog family is in need of a breeding boost, with hopes resting on minuscule male Eddie, who needs to summon up all his stamina to successfully court his frog princess Fergie

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Charlotte comes into the sanctuary looking for a best friend for Zeke the pug. Harley meets potential adopters the Macdonald family and former dancer Natasha could be the perfect match for husky cross Aislinn

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Professional deep-sea diver Adrian Corrigall and his wife Megan plan to build their new family home in rural East Sussex almost entirely out of concrete, with construction involving cutting-edge technologies conceived in Switzerland and never used to build a house before. However, the perils of being a pioneer soon become evident, and with both schedule and budget under strain, Adrian is forced to resume work as a diver, taking him away from the project for a month at a time

programme.title: Lost Pharaohs of the Nile
programme.desc: The work of archaeologists to excavate sites along the Sudanese Nile Valley, from pyramids to temples, which once formed part of Ancient Egypt, ruled by a dynasty known as the Black Pharaohs. Featuring the world's first investigation of the submerged burial chambers of a pyramid, the discovery of what appears to be a major Black Pharaoh power base near the great temple of Jebel Barkal, and using drones to show the full extent of the Black Pharaoh's Kingdom for the first time - the experts in this film challenge the view that Egypt is Africa's only 'great' civilisation

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: The trauma team rush to 67-year-old Walter, who has sustained a life-threatening head injury after falling down a remote hillside while walking with his sister. In Aberdeen, 62-year-old Liz has been rushed to hospital with a serious chainsaw cut to her arm, while 52-year-old Philip has crashed his motorbike at high speed and is lying in the central reservation of the motorway

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Scaffolder Thomas arrives at London's King's College Hospital after suffering a head injury at a building site and doctors are concerned he may have fractured his skull, back or neck. Hilton, 85, has diabetes and is worried about his swollen legs, and retired architect Edgar is struggling to breathe following an asthma attack. Meanwhile, in the waiting room, two women make friends and swap stories and jokes

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A motorcycle collision on the M25 creates chaos as the heli-medics close carriageways to treat a driver with an injured leg. Medics near Shepshed are called in to assist Glenn, who has fallen down the stairs fracturing his femur

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called when a man has his third seizure of the day, while a fishing trip ends with a man having to be cut out of his friend's car

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Scaffolder Thomas arrives at London's King's College Hospital after suffering a head injury at a building site and doctors are concerned he may have fractured his skull, back or neck. Hilton, 85, has diabetes and is worried about his swollen legs, and retired architect Edgar is struggling to breathe following an asthma attack. Meanwhile, in the waiting room, two women make friends and swap stories and jokes

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Briony May Williams finds out why some radishes are hotter than others. Andi Oliver wonders why pre-made sandwiches seem to invariably have mayonnaise in them, while Kate Quilton heads north to the Scottish isles to discover how they are growing truffles

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits the Devon County Show, where she discovers the secret of home-made handscrub and learns about beekeeping and making beeswax candles. She also tries her hand at crafting jewellery in silver clay - an ideal way of making unusual but inexpensive gifts

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple of bike lovers launch a new cycling business in Spain, while in France, a motorhome rental business deals with a busy day of bookings

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Cockermouth, Cumbria, Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole meet blacksmith Jon, who spent many years working on fairgrounds. At the valuation, independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan reckons there's rich pickings to be made from railway memorabilia

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien continue their mission to repurpose old cast-offs into cash, making an extraordinary find from a Dutch designer in accountant Debbie's lean-to

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: After the detectives' hard work, a person visits the home of a relative she didn't know existed, and who surprisingly lives just 10 minutes' from her own house. On another case, the hunters experience a strange sense of déjà vu when they trace heirs to the estate of a woman they have met before, and their search uncovers the remarkable history of Thames bargemen. Plus, details of more unclaimed estates are divulged

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Carmarthenshire, at the School House B&B, owned by eco-friendly married couple Jayne and Ian Hall-Edwards, who hope that their environmental approach will impress their guests. At dinner, Ian reveals that his hosting skills might not be up to scratch and eyebrows are raised at straight-talking colleagues Jo and Neil. At breakfast, assumptions are made of businessman Raj

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey. On arrival, guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but Raj is shocked to find breakfast is not included

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Leafy Suburban B&B in Northwood, Hertfordshire, where the guests spend the afternoon taking a swing at some golfing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to the Wellington Inn, Hertfordshire, where Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach, cleansing the aura of the rooms and encouraging guests to feel the vibe

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The School House B&B is first and host Jayne Hall-Edwards takes guests back to basics over her green policy. Next, Neil Chidzey and Jo Goodwin from Cathedral 73 challenge their guests over costings

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Barbara and Stephen have had 20 happy years in their Victorian riverside cottage in Surrey, but with retirement looming, they are undecided what to do next. Stephen loves their home, while Barbara dreams of starting afresh in a new home - where she would need a separate room for her drum kit. Phil Spencer comes up with a few options should they decide to up sticks, while Kirstie Allsopp is full of ideas allowing Barbara to get out her sticks. Will they decide to stay or sell?

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: A couple of giant otters give birth to four pups after losing their first litter a few months ago. However, dad Tarubu need to step up and become more responsible - especially after leaving one of the little ones outside late at night. Red river hog Kya is being bullied by her triplet sisters. Losing weight and dangerously fragile, she will need to build up her strength and fight back if she is to survive. Keepers worry about batagur turtle Donatello, who is off his food and swimming at an odd angle

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Karin, who has mobility problems, is looking for a canine companion and the sanctuary think Harlie the Maltese might be the right fit. German shepherd Seth meets Sheppy

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud visits Sue and Martin who set out to renovate two 16th and 18th-century barns in 1999. Without conventional plans, surveys and specifications the project was delayed a number of times. The original deadline of Christmas 2000 came and went and by September 2002 the build was still not finished. Kevin returns two decades later to see if the house is finally complete

programme.title: Dunkirk: The Forgotten Heroes
programme.desc: The untold story of what happened after the Dunkirk evacuation, told by the men who were there and using recently declassified secret documents. Following the evacuation, tens of thousands of British troops were still left in France, fighting for their lives. The 51st Highland Division were ordered to fight on against the Hitler's war machine and now, almost 80 years later, the only remaining survivors of that Division tell their extraordinary story for the first time

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff of King's College Hospital reflect on the different ways in which people deal with physical and emotional pain as they treat a new batch of patients. Ahmed, 28, dislocated his shoulder during a game of American football and grits his teeth as a doctor slots it back into place. Meanwhile, 24-year-old Lee is living with Behcet's disease, a condition that affects his nervous system and causes pain so severe he passes out, and father-of-four Simon, 30, has been found unconscious at the bottom of a stairwell and it emerges he hasn't eaten for days following a relationship break-up

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sarah, 35, arrives at King's College Hospital concerned that a brain tumour she first had as a teenager has returned. Helen, 47, is worried about her baby son James, who was born with a hole in his heart and one kidney, and has been vomiting since the morning, while 28-year-old Wayne seeks treatment for knife wounds to his leg after he tried to stop someone stealing his girlfriend's phone

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Charlie has life-threatening injuries after coming off his dirt bike from a great height. The heli-medics race to treat him as a matter of great urgency. Worried parents watch on as medics treat their five-year-old child who is having seizures

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Incidents involving the West Midlands Ambulance Service at night, including a fight in a fast food restaurant, and a woman who has fallen while carrying her four-month-old grandson

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
