Ahmed, 28, dislocated his shoulder during a game of American football and grits his teeth as a doctor slots it back into place. Meanwhile, 24-year-old Lee is living with Behcet's disease, a condition that affects his nervous system and causes pain so severe he passes out, and father-of-four Simon, 30, has been found unconscious at the bottom of a stairwell and it emerges he hasn't eaten for days following a relationship break-up

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt discovers why some fruits are hairier than others, while Kate Quilton learns what's the difference between single and double cream. Plus, Briony May Williams examines the science of canned food and it can last so long

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: A Rolls Royce for Omar Sharif is wrapped in creamy white and chrome rose gold, which mixes classic styling and a state-of-the-art chrome wrap

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Yianni suggests a chrome pink wrap for a rare supercar being readied for a car rally, but owners Mark and Steve needs some serious persuasion

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond tests Volkswagen's Touareg off-roader, before driving a racing version of the car against a group of snowmobile riders in Sweden. James May tries to drive faster than he has ever done before in the Bugatti Veyron Super Sport, Jeremy Clarkson examines the legacy of Formula One driver Ayrton Senna, and Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz are the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Chesterfield, Derbyshire, to help Lisa and Richard Watson. With an expanding family and a young daughter who requires 24-hour care, builder Richard has not been able to complete an extension he started, but along with support from the building trade and local community, the team hopes to lift the strain on the family

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets chef Tom Adams, who runs Combeshead Farm, a leading field-to-fork restaurant where they grow and produce all of their own food, from sourdough bread to pork pies, as well as rearing a small herd of Mangalitsa pigs, a hairy, old-world breed that produces exquisite hams. Rick tries out a new recipe - pork chops with a sloe berry sauce - before moving on to the village of Rock, where his son Jack holds a clam bake on the shore of the Camel Estuary

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick discovers an unusual superstition and a rare type of Norman castle in Launceston, before meeting musicians Graham Fitkin and Ruth Wall in the far west of Cornwall

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: A 40-tonne boat called King Arthur needs moving from Bristol, while in Essex, a number of vintage cars must be carefully transported to a sales fair

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Police officers request a new police support unit or riot van, while a stolen car chase ends with an X5 wedged in a hedge. Boss Mick Sweetmore goes back to the floor with Merseyside's mental health team and discovers another side to modern-day policing - as well as the poor state of the vehicle they are currently using

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond celebrates the 40th anniversary of the Ferrari Daytona by taking one back to its spiritual home - the Italian Riviera - before trying to beat James May and a powerboat in a race from Portofino to St Tropez. Back in the UK, Jeremy Clarkson tests the BMW M3 saloon and compares it with the Lexus IS-F. Grand Designs presenter Kevin McCloud is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond tests Volkswagen's Touareg off-roader, before driving a racing version of the car against a group of snowmobile riders in Sweden. James May tries to drive faster than he has ever done before in the Bugatti Veyron Super Sport, Jeremy Clarkson examines the legacy of Formula One driver Ayrton Senna, and Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz are the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than £1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Chesterfield, Derbyshire, to help Lisa and Richard Watson. With an expanding family and a young daughter who requires 24-hour care, builder Richard has not been able to complete an extension he started, but along with support from the building trade and local community, the team hopes to lift the strain on the family

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets his good friend, the actor and comedian Barry Humphries, who fell in love with Cornwall in the 1960s when he escaped London to develop his famous character Dame Edna Everage. Barry talks about his friendship with British poet John Betjeman, and asks Rick to review his home-made fishcakes. Rick also goes fishing for crab, before cooking a simple yet delicious crab omelette. The host then takes a dip in the chilly north Atlantic with an eccentric group of wild water swimmers called the Perranporth Blue Tits

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick journeys inland from the majestic Camel Estuary to one of Britain's finest vineyards, where he joins in harvesting the grapes to discover that the Cornish weather is perfect making some of the best wine in the country. Just off Pentire Point, as the sun sets, Rick rides the gentle swell of the north Atlantic with an old friend, casting his line to hook Britain's fastest fish, before firing up the barbecue to cook his catch with a recipe inspired from a trip to Goa. Rick joins Tim Smit, best known for starting the hugely successful Eden Project, who reveals to Rick his new and ambitious idea in Cornwall

High above the Prairie at Riding Mountain, he discovers how a middle-class British boy from Hastings transformed himself into an influential indigenous naturalist called Grey Owl. Deep in the Prairie, he finds a network of railways that once served the wheat farmers of Saskatchewan, and learns how communities grew up around the grain elevators used to load the crops on to rail wagons

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Baddesley Clinton, a moated manor house near Birmingham. Items brought in to be valued include a diamond bracelet once worn by Rita Hayworth, a wooden peg that was removed from a child's eye in the 1870s, a painting by Lord Mountbatten of his family home and a controversial carving of St George that offended a church's parishioners. One visitor brings in a rare wooden pedestal, and is chastised by one of the Roadshow experts for stripping it of the original paintwork

Progressing along the Long Island Railroad to Queens, Michael takes in an ambitious engineering project and a model town built by an Irish immigrant who became one of America's richest men. He feels none of the meals served to him have met required standards and firmly believes his restaurant style menu will help bag him the £1,000. However, his choice of main course surprises the others and some of the ingredients in the starter are unexpected too

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Joiner Craig and wine industry worker Suzy started dating nearly nine years ago and between them have three children. After discovering the seaside town of Los Gigantes on Tenerife six years ago, they've been back many times and have now decided that it's the perfect place to buy a holiday home for all the family. To help them fulfil their dream, Jasmine Harman hunts out five great options for them to view within their £200,000 budget, but will any be the one to capture their hearts?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Rhona Brennan and daughter Nina find the perfect family holiday home that could also work as a B&B in the French region of Limousin. Working within a budget of £165,000, Jasmine delivers five properties in spectacular locations, but it remains to be seen whether the pair will be bowled over by one of the options

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect meets Duncan and Josie, who are taking on an 18th-century barn perched on the edge of a pretty green, containing some very dodgy décor including a purple striped '80s kitchen and a miniature kitchen extension built to house a washing machine. Duncan and Josie need to make it liveable very quickly as they welcome their new baby Ruby, so George sets out to make the dark, cramped layout work for modern family living. He also heads to Southport, Merseyside, to see a Victorian gothic property in need of attention. Owners Jenny and Fadi are keen to resore the pile to its original splendor

programme.title: Millionaire Hoarders
programme.desc: Retired artists Carole and Roger have filled every room of their nine-bed Georgian home with unusual objects they've collected from around the world. Their country pile is in urgent need of repair; and with little income coming in, they call on the experts to help sift through the items to potentially unearth prized items that could raise life-changing sums of cash. Plus, high-end pawnbroker Rachel investigates a huge collection of jewellery owned by former lawyer Emma, who gave up her high-flying job to follow her dream of starting a jewellery business and needs extra money to stay afloat

programme.title: Alone

Noel meets the animals threatened by poaching, injured due to neglect in captivity, and exploited in one way or another. The pioneering vet also helps endangered rhinos and improve the lives of two big cats by performing procedures rarely - if ever - provided for wild animals before

There is also a visit to familiar faces Joe and Jan, who have been married for 47 years, and handed over their animal charity last year to their friend Jacqui, in a bid to try and enjoy their retirement. Then the unthinkable happened, when 69-year-Jan was diagnosed with breast cancer

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A foul-mouthed pensioner pushes Barry's patience to the limit, Sarah gives a bad-boy biker an early birthday present and Jim's Audi S3 is outclassed by a car 30 years its senior. Plus, Mike is left open-mouthed when he encounters a drink-driver who is three times over the limit

programme.title: Police Interceptors

Guest starring Timothy Bottoms (The Last Picture Show)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An investigation into the rape and murder of a woman revives harrowing memories for Ducky, who once worked on a similar case in which the killer was never captured and vowed to return. Bafflingly, both victims were civilians dressed in the uniform of a lieutenant, and each had a trident symbol carved into their neck. Starring Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An accident at a Navy bombing range brings to light an area used by the Mafia to dump bodies. One of the corpses is identified as a missing FBI agent, so the team investigates the events leading up to his death. Crime drama, guest starring Joe Spano, with Mark Harmon

programme.desc: The team investigates the stabbing of a teacher whose body has been found in a caretaker's cupboard. The hunt for her killer leads to the discovery that she was caught up in a love triangle at school involving a student with multiple identities. Legal drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of a female rock singer, who apparently died of an overdose of cocaine and heroin. However, their inquiry is hampered by the appearance of a retired officer using unorthodox research tactics to find out the truth. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a struggling actress in what appears to have been a bungled robbery. Saul Rubinek, JK Simmons and Sonia Braga guest star alongside Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green think they have got their man when the prime suspect in a murder investigation knows every detail about the killing. programme.desc: A US Marine suspected of murdering a girl is killed in Iraq, and a search of his personal belongings reveals her body. Most members of the team believe they have found conclusive evidence of his guilt - but Gibbs suspects there is more to the situation than meets the eye

However, the setback leads to a Mob hitman who provides information needed to pursue a case against the family

programme.desc: Two thieves discover the skeletal remains of a woman who was believed to have died in the September 11 attacks on the World Trade Centre. It transpires that a valuable and unusual ring has been stolen from the body, and the team suspects foul play.

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green are assigned to investigate the execution-style killing of a prominent businessman, and discover his wife was having an affair. However, further evidence emerges, suggesting a different motive - and an unlikely conspirator. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green look into the shooting of defence lawyer Vance Grodie, who had just won an acquittal for a suspected cop killer. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the death of a Russian model, and when the autopsy reveals a host of old injuries they suspect long-term abuse. Further tests are made on the body, and the findings suggest medical malpractice may have been the cause, leading the detectives to track down the person responsible for her death. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star

programme.desc: Four murders occur in Manhattan, all of which seem to have been committed by the same sniper. Ty Burrell (Modern Family) guest stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony is infected with a deadly virus sent through the post by shadowy figures who demand the details of a long-closed case be made public in exchange for the antidote. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The charred body of an Asian girl is found outside the apartment of the Chinese consul general. Forensics discover she was murdered before her corpse was burned, prompting detectives to investigate rumours that the diplomat is somehow connected. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Documentary series taking viewers inside the UK Border Agency, revealing the work that takes place behind the scenes of the immigration process. programme.title: UBOS
programme.desc: Cassy, Vern & Gus are gifted students who go to an enchanted school to learn about magic. After receiving a book named UBOS (Ultimate Book of Spells) they soon begin their journey of a lifetime

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Skysurfer Strike Force
programme.desc: Jack Holister is an extraordinary skydiver who leads a group of vigilante crime fighters known as the Skysurfer Strike Force. who must try to seek out and defeat the robotic Cybron

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: John Mannering does a deal with a crooked insurance agent in order to recover an Aztec mask worth a hundred thousand pounds from an ex-convict

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Harvey is given the brush-off by his son's schoolteacher, and Lou is forced to spend time recovering

programme.title: Italy Made With Love
programme.desc: An intimate look into Italian culture, where we find the hidden treasures in each unique region and let the locals share their stories, heritage and culture, as only they can

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: A workman arrives to fix a hole in the space-time continuum, leaving Gary facing a dilemma of epic proportions concerning which life - and indeed which wife - to plump for. Meanwhile, Ron thinks he has a lucrative business deal on the cards. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: An evil demon and three witches plot to kill the disciples in a bid to bring themselves back to life. Cult adventure series, starring Masoaki Sakai

programme.title: Appointment in London (1952)
programme.desc: Over the course of one month in 1943, an intense rivalry develops between an overworked wing commander and an American officer - but the two try to put aside personal feelings for the sake of the war effort. Second World War drama, starring Dirk Bogarde, Bryan Forbes, Dinah Sheridan and William Sylvester

programme.title: John and Julie (1953)
programme.desc: Two children are desperate to watch the coronation of Elizabeth II firsthand, so run away from home and make their way to London. As they wander the city in search of the Queen, they have a series of adventures with an assortment of eccentric characters. Comedy, starring Colin Gibson, Lesley Dudley, Peter Sellers and Sid James

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Poplar for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: When Koening is forced to crash land his ship, he finds himself stranded on a strange moon. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Europe's Wilderness
programme.desc: A journey of discovery to a wonderful world of breath-taking views and endangered species with each episode focusing on one animal and its lifestyle, needs and habitat

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie starts an unusual business - a shop that specialises in selling useless merchandise. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Pauline Yates and Tim Preece

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Nineteen Nineteen (1985)
programme.desc: Two former patients of Sigmund Freud meet again and discuss the psychiatric treatment they underwent 65 years earlier. Period drama, starring Paul Scofield and Maria Schell

programme.title: United (2011)
programme.desc: Drama charting the story of the 'Busby Babes' - the Manchester United side who became the youngest-ever winners of the English Football League in 1956. Having won the league again in 1957, the team reaches the quarter-finals of the European Cup in 1958 - but disaster strikes as they return from the match in Belgrade, when their charter plane crashes following a refuelling stop in Munich. The disaster claims the lives of 23 people, including eight players - and with manager Matt Busby in a critical condition, coach Jimmy Murphy tries to rebuild the shattered team. Starring David Tennant, Jack O'Connell, Sam Claflin and Dougray Scott

programme.title: Cockneys vs Zombies (2012)
programme.desc: Two brothers plan to rob a bank to save their grandfather's retirement home. However, on the day of the heist, an ancient tomb is disturbed in London's Docklands, unleashing a horde of zombies. As the crooks fight their way through the city, the residents of the care home fight back against the besieging undead. Comedy horror, starring Harry Treadaway, Rasmus Hardiker, Richard Briers and Honor Blackman

programme.title: A Touch of Love (1969)
programme.desc: A single mother is determined to go it alone in spite of the social stigma and practical problems in her path. Drama, starring Sandy Dennis and Ian McKellen

programme.desc: John Mannering does a deal with a crooked insurance agent in order to recover an Aztec mask worth a hundred thousand pounds from an ex-convict

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Rita is depressed after only just escaping the clutches of murderer Neville Heath

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed goes undercover to investigate whether a series of murders is linked to the activities of a marriage bureau. Starring Patrick Macnee, Diana Rigg, and guest star Patrick Cargill

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: A trip to entertain the troops in France forces Gary to play the hero as a sudden German push calls for extreme measures. Back in the 1990s, Ron's girlfriend returns from a Caribbean holiday with more than just a tan. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie starts an unusual business - a shop that specialises in selling useless merchandise. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Pauline Yates and Tim Preece

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Sudbury and Perivale for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Bulldog Breed (1960)
programme.desc: A bumbling grocer is rejected by the woman of his dreams, plunging him into misery. He decides to get over his heartbreak by joining the Navy, and despite his ineptitude, is selected by an admiral to become Britain's first astronaut. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Ian Hunter, David Lodge and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: The Shop at Sly Corner (1947)
programme.desc: An ex-convict murders his blackmailing book-keeper in an effort to protect his violinist daughter's blossoming career. Thriller, starring Oscar Homolka, Muriel Pavlow, Derek Farr and Irene Handl

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Crystal Palace and Shoreditch. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: Andi takes the road to organise a tourist activity likely to generate essential income for the reserve. Meanwhile, game hunters visit Glen Garriff

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Auschwitz in 33 Objects
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind the personal items and belongings left behind in Auschwitz Birkenau, a former nazi concentration and extermination camp, the world's largest cemetery and resting place

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the Scottish Highlands' peaks and heather moorlands, where a mix of mammals and birds have adapted to an ecology that is unique in Britain. He waits until dawn to witness the black grouse's secretive courtship display, encounters a herd of reindeer and scales the Cairngorms to spot a mountain hare

programme.title: Top Tens of Warfare
programme.desc: Archive footage and expert interviews revisit the most devastating battles of the 20th century, from the massacres on the Somme and the beaches of Normandy to the first Gulf War

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: Series in which families reveal the moment their lives changed forever - when they were told their missing loved ones had been murdered

programme.title: Boy In The Corner (2022)
programme.desc: A teenager in an impoverished neighbourhood finds his dreams crushed, pushing him towards a life of crime. Crime drama, starring Cyran Vergara and Victoria Shepherd

programme.title: South of the River (2020)
programme.desc: A singer is diagnosed with throat cancer, and must choose between his band and his medical treatment. Drama, starring Alex Gillison and Joe Watkins

programme.title: That'll Be the Day (1973)
programme.desc: A school dropout leaves home and drifts through a succession of dead-end jobs until he finds an outlet for his frustration in rock 'n' roll. Drama, starring David Essex, Ringo Starr, Keith Moon, Billy Fury, Robert Lindsay and Rosemary Leach

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: Sequel to The Comic Strip Presents: Five Go Mad in Dorset, made 30 years later to celebrate its anniversary. The young heroes have now grown up, but Dick in particular remains out of touch with the modern world. Anne is teetering on the edge of a nervous breakdown, while George is struggling to stay off alcohol. Julian shares George's drink problem - as well as having a couple of shady characters on his tail. Adrian Edmondson, Dawn French, Jennifer Saunders and Peter Richardson star

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to explore more of the remote and fascinating places that lie off the mainland, beginning with a cluster of islands in the Outer Hebrides. He starts his journey just off the coast of North Uist at Berneray, then heads south to Grimsay and Kirkibost, before ending on the deserted whisky island of Pabbay

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton journeys around the coast of the Long Island of Harris and Lewis, beginning on Scarp, travelling north to Great Bernera, then south east to Scalpay. These islands may seem to exist in the shadow of their much larger neighbours, but Paul discovers they have a distinct identity all of their own, as he hears remarkable stories of crofter rebellions, rocket mail and a rich local culture

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: An evil demon and three witches plot to kill the disciples in a bid to bring themselves back to life. Cult adventure series, starring Masoaki Sakai

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: When Koening is forced to crash land his ship, he finds himself stranded on a strange moon. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau

programme.title: The Clue of the Missing Ape (1953)
programme.desc: Two children uncover a plot by a gang of crooks to blow up British ships that are harboured near Gibraltar. Children's adventure, starring George Cole and Nati Banda

programme.title: A Tale of Two Cities (1935)
programme.desc: A disreputable English lawyer helps a French aristocrat overcome charges of treason, but finds himself falling for the man's fiancee. Adaptation of Dickens' classic novel set during the bloodshed of the French Revolution, starring Ronald Colman, Elizabeth Allan, Donald Woods and Basil Rathbone

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed goes undercover to investigate whether a series of murders is linked to the activities of a marriage bureau. Starring Patrick Macnee, Diana Rigg, and guest star Patrick Cargill

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: Recipes include lemongrass soup, oriental steamed soy chicken and vegetables, chilli-crab linguine with vodka, and passion fruit souffles

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Italy Made With Love
programme.desc: While Puglia may be off-the-beaten path for some tourists, many travellers know that some of the most amazing crafts and the best food can be found down at the heel of Italy's famous boot

programme.title: Let Him Have It (1991)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the controversial 1952 murder trial in which 19-year-old Derek Bentley was sentenced to be hanged for killing a policeman - even though his friend Chris Craig was the one who fired the fatal gunshot. Starring Christopher Eccleston, Paul Reynolds, Tom Courtenay, Eileen Atkins, Tom Bell and Mark McGann

programme.title: Nineteen Nineteen (1985)
programme.desc: Two former patients of Sigmund Freud meet again and discuss the psychiatric treatment they underwent 65 years earlier. Period drama, starring Paul Scofield and Maria Schell

programme.title: A Touch of Love (1969)
programme.desc: A single mother is determined to go it alone in spite of the social stigma and practical problems in her path. Drama, starring Sandy Dennis and Ian McKellen

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital

programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Portsmouth v Exeter City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Live coverage of the League One clash from Fratton Park. The home side have had the upper hand in this meeting over the years, winning 16 of the 31 games between the two teams. They haven't lost to their opponents since January 2017, and have won three of the past four meetings. The last time the two sides met was in January of this year, when the home team came out 2-0 winners

programme.desc: Portsmouth v Exeter City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Live coverage of the League One clash from Fratton Park. The home side have had the upper hand in this meeting over the years, winning 16 of the 31 games between the two teams. The last time the two sides met was in January of this year, when the home team came out 2-0 winners
